Colt provides network, voice and data centre services to thousands of businesses around the world, allowing them to focus on delivering their business goals instead of the underlying infrastructure.

#LI-DNI

Location - Europe

Role and Accountabilities
Reporting to the Market Consultancy Director; the Cybersecurity Specialist will contribute to Colt’s market position as a leading provider of connectivity solutions by transforming market knowledge, customer perspectives, and leading edge technical competencies into innovative ideas for market development. In collaboration with the market development team, the specialist will consult with Colt partners (existing and new), analysts and customers to identify new technical solutions and joint value propositions incorporating cybersecurity services. The Cybersecurity Specialist will enable incubation and co-creation to deliver compelling value propositions that demonstrate true business value, that lead to Proof Of Concepts and that result in future productized Colt product offerings.

Strategic Skills
10+ Years’+ experience including a broad commercial acumen and market awareness in the Global Telecommunications and security eco-system.
A candidate who is up-to-date with customer ICT strategy, technology and policy and who can articulate competently the cybersecurity market and the context of security and governance within the wider ICT environment, both to internal stakeholders, partners and end customers.
An awareness of the Partner eco-system in order to support the identification of new security partners that can provide joint value propositions and an understanding as to how these are best brought to market.
An Enterprise Architect mindset, knowledge of methodologies such as TOGAF, to guide the consulting and solution approach.
Commercial solution design including pricing, value proposition definition and governance compliance.
Commercial and product expertise to support joint value creation focused on business outcomes.
Developing and presenting the compelling business case both internally and externally.
Subject Matter Expertise
An expert in cyber security solutions – Including but not limited to:
SIEM and incident response services.
Cloud Security.
Firewall, DDoS, Encryption, URL Filtering, Anti-virus, Threat management.
Zero Trust Architecture and SASE.
Access Control / Authentication.
Data Governance including GDPR.
Vulnerability Management.
Relevant standards such as ISO27001, SSAE/ ISAE 3402 SOC
An expert in security solutions and the customer transformation journey to Modern security architectures.
An understanding of IP networking and the interaction and implications of WAN Design on security solutions.
Ability to assess security service operational models and service location (On Premise, EDGE, Cloud) and relevance to Colt solution capabilities.
Tactical requirements
A collaborative and open approach to working with different members within the Market Development team and with wider stakeholders within the business including the Technology & Security Office.
Maintain a high degree of and thorough knowledge of all Colt products, services capabilities.
Maintain a high degree of and thorough knowledge of the Security Eco-system.
Develop a strategy to evolve the application and joint partner opportunities of the Security offerings within Colt.
Monitor competitor and market activity/trends and provide feedback in to Colt’s strategy and innovation business teams.
Critically evaluate 3rd Party partners and all Colt concerned departments to ensure solutions are relevant and within Colts ability to deliver.
Support contract construction and predict / overcome client concerns.
Meet and work closely with the partners and analysts to understand business objectives, needs, requirements and compelling criteria and best market practice.
Support the CCO organization including sales engineering teams to guide the release of new technology and solutions to the sales force.
Identify and quantify the associated gaps and risks within the strategy in conjunction with the Partner managers, and other supporting entities whenever appropriate.
Active involvement with external analysts and forums to extend and develop contacts with existing and potential partners and vendors and to share these contacts with relevant teams across the business.
Adherence to Colt governance processes, tools and sales methodology.
What you will need to succeed
Experience in solution consultancy and product co-creation.
Proven track record of leading and operating within multi-partner teams.
A thought leader and subject matter expert – Cybersecurity & competitive landscape.
Exceptional negotiation and influencing ability of digital transformation, security and data architectural design.
Accustomed to engaging and presenting to influence at all levels.
Strong ability to convert requirements in to written documentation, proposals and Statements of Work for approval.
Excellent understanding of ICT challenges, technologies and the competitive environment.
Experience in working with international teams on longer term projects.
Commercial Acumen - good understanding of pricing strategies, financial analysis methods and negotiation strategies
What we offer:

Colt is a growing business that is investing in its people. We offer skill development, learning pathways and accreditation to help our people perform at their best, regardless of role and location.

In addition to offering competitive salaries and incentive plans, a range of benefits and local rewards packages are offered to staff. Colt recognises the importance of a work life balance.

Some benefit examples are:
Flexible working and relaxed dress code
Two days annually to spend on volunteering opportunities
Pension and insurance options
Access to a virtual business school for on-going learning
Business mentoring
Discounts with local hospitality and retail providers

Job Title: Temp Specialist Parent & Youth Support Practitioner
Job Description:
What's involved with this role:
An Enhanced DBS is required. Work flexible hours based on children, young people and family’s needs which requires regular evening and weekend work. The Specialist Youth Support Practitioner is responsible and accountable for the planning, delivery and evaluation of high-quality individualised support for parents and young people. This requires effective liaison and partnership working across a wide range of stakeholders, including but not limited to: Service Users, Children’s Social Care, Health, Education, Youth Justice and the voluntary, community and private sectors. Key responsibilities:
providing a high quality, effective and responsive crisis service for parents/carers and their children and young people
working with parents/carers and young people to support the repairing of relationship difficulties and thereby reducing the likelihood of care and accommodation being needed
encouraging young people to get involved in activities that complement and enhance their physical and emotional wellbeing, and which support their educational attainment and transition to employment
providing additional support as required at critical times and stages of a young person’s development
supporting young people to do things for themselves individually and collectively and to be active participants in their community.

Please quote the Job Title & Vacancy Reference No. in your application, or we will be unable to match your CV to the role being applied for.

“Essential Requirements” – Please check to ensure that your CV addresses the following items:
Our clients are generally seeking applicants who are reasonably local, so on that basis we would ideally like you to supply us with your address (or at least your post code) and a telephone number so that we can reach you during working hours.
Your recent UK working experience going back at least 5 years, or full employment history if you have been working for fewer years than this.
Your availability to work either immediately, or at short notice.
Unless the DBS requirement stated above is for a Basic Disclosure, your DBS must be either through us or be accompanied by a subscription to the DBS updating service.
Qualifications:
Relevant professional or occupational qualification in Youth Work, Teaching, Health, Social Pedagogy or Social Work; Arts, sporting or outdoor education qualifications, e.g. Music, drama, MLA, FA level 1 (desirable).
Evidence of continuing professional development.
First Aid qualification or willingness and ability to successfully pass first aid training.
Experience:
A minimum of two years' experience of direct work with children and families.
Experience of at least one year of working with children/ young people on the edge of care.
Experience of working with parents and carers
A working knowledge of working with families where safeguarding issues may be a concern.
Knowledge and experience of youth participation legislation, strategies and methods.
A working knowledge of Youth Justice Legislation, policy and guidance.
Knowledge of accreditation programmes and experience of curriculum development and implementation.
Experience in using a range of intervention methods, models theories and tools.
Able to demonstrate a track record in the delivery of high quality customer focused services.
Experience of delivering services within an urban and ethnically diverse context and developing and delivering appropriate services.
Experience in working on an inter-agency and inter-departmental basis.
Knowledge & Skills:
Knowledge of the relevant legislation, policy and guidance relating to Children and Young People's Services.
Understanding of the roles and responsibilities of key agencies working with young people, including their statutory responsibilities.
Understanding of child and adolescent development, and the importance of peer influence, family and wider environmental factors upon their personal growth and transition to adulthood.
Ability to engage with and create a rapport and build relationships with young people and parents / carers and families and to deal with complex issues in a sensitive and appropriate manner.
Ability to assess risks posed to, and by, children and young people and propose appropriate arrangements for safeguarding their well-being and protection of the public.
Able to devise effective preventative and educational interventions for children and young people and translate them into realisable plans.
Ability to formulate, implement and evidence effective individual and targeted group interventions.
Able to demonstrate professional integrity together with an enthusiastic and positive attitude towards children, young people, families, staff, and stakeholders.
Ability to work calmly and confidently with conflict.
Able to achieve solid buy in from staff, colleagues, and officials across the council, members, external partners and all stakeholders.
Ability to summarise, analyse and evaluate complex information.
Strong IT skills including Microsoft packages.
Other preferable/desirable details to include on your CV, if applicable:
Any local authority/public sector experience.
Any relevant qualifications held or being studied for.

Job Title: Hospitality & Contract Sales Specialist - U.K. and Ireland
Job Description:
The exceptional team at JANUS et Cie, now part of Haworth and the Poltrona Frau Group, serves commercial, hospitality and residential clients with a dedicated focus on design leadership, outstanding quality, and unparalleled service. The company’s namesake—the Roman god JANUS, whose two faces look both forward and back—is the foundation of a unified mission rooted in tradition and heritage, yet equally dedicated to innovative materials and superior craftsmanship. This inspired long-term view is realized through the lens of a unique corporate culture that encourages curiosity, creativity and collaboration in the pursuit of excellence. Acclaimed by the most discriminating designers, architects, and clients throughout the world, the company’s powerful body of work is actualized by a top-of-class team.

Outstanding quality, superior craftsmanship and excellence is paramount at JANUS et Cie and our product reflects our unified mission: rooted in tradition, heritage and craft, yet equally dedicated to innovative materials and progressive engineering. Acclaimed by the most discriminating designers, architects and juried competitions, our powerful body of work has inspired for decades a demand for beautifully imagined furnishings to be used both indoors and out, and has influenced an entire industry in the process.

The continuous development of our brand is supported by what we believe to be our most valuable assets: our people. Enthusiastic experts at the forefront of emerging concepts and industry trends, our company is driven by a culture of creativity, collaboration and curiosity. Our team at JANUS et Cie is comprised of individuals who share a high commitment to personal achievement, who enjoy constantly learning, and whose talents are nurtured and developed through a supportive, energetic workplace with a longstanding position in the luxury furniture market.

JANUS et Cie currently has an opportunity for a Hospitality & Contract Sales Specialist to drive sales in the U.K. and Ireland.
Under the direction of the Vice President of Sales for EMEA, the Sales Specialist will be responsible for the following:
Meet or exceed monthly, quarterly and yearly sales goals for the U.K. and Ireland
Develop new business through prospecting, tracking leads and having product specified or converting projects
Deliver live presentations to both large and small groups, including designers, dealers and end-users
Service existing corporate business with large direct accounts which will be expanded to specifications driven by dealers, designers, corporate accounts, municipalities and landscape architects
Visit with current accounts to ensure client satisfaction and growth of business
Consistently upsell from existing competitor’s quotes and understand crossover products available for quoting from other sector catalogs of JANUS et Cie
Attend sector specific trade shows
Work with other JANUS et Cie departments to identify and communicate product and pricing gap opportunities to grow market advantage
Other duties as needed
The ideal candidate will have the following combination of education, experience and skills:
5+ years of successful sales experience working with hospitality & contract designers, dealers and end-users
Motivated self-starter with hunter mentality combined with a polished image that is in line with the company’s mission and values
Bachelor’s degree is preferred
Thorough knowledge of hospitality & contract furniture industry, including competitors, projects in process and relationships with key influencers and decisions
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Good knowledge of the Microsoft suite of programs (Office, Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
Qualified candidates for this career position in a growth-oriented and stable company, recognized for quality and brand leadership, are encouraged to apply.

JANUS et Cie is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

SEN Specialist - Kingston
Role: LSA
Hours: 8:30-3:30
Full and Part time

Are you a Support Specialist?

Are you looking for a new challenge within Primary schools?

Protocol Education is looking to recruit experienced support staff to work with pupils with various needs such as:

•Autism (ASC) is often diagnosed during primary education - pupils may need support in class to keep them on task and potentially deal with any behaviour issues
•Moderate Learning Difficulties (MLD) (including Down Syndrome) can mean pupils fall behind, become isolated from friends and need support to adjust and work at a pace to suit their ability
•Specific Learning Difficulties (SpLD) such as Dyslexia can mean a pupil needs support understanding work set and keeping on track - special adjustments may be required and extra time to embed new topics and learning is often supported with learning support
•Physical Disability - may require access, personal care or mobility

These are the most common types of SEN you will come across in Primary Schools.

Do you have experience in one or more of these needs or Do you hold any relevant qualifications wanting to apply it in practice?

What Protocol Education can offer:

•Protocol Education is a national company with strong and long-standing links to Schools across the country. Within London we source staff for Mainstream and SEND Schools in all London Boroughs as well as Surrey, Kent and Bromley.
•Optional CPD Training in our Tottenham Court Road Office
•Competitive salary
•A dedicated consultant

Protocol offers flexible roles; daily supply, long-term placements and a choice of part-time or full-time roles.

What we require from you:
•References from two of your most recent employers.
•Have a valid DBS, which is on the update service or be willing apply for a new one
•Have the right to work in the UK

If this sounds like you then we want to hear from you. Apply for the role or call Ricky Uddin on 02089711285 for more information.

Company Description

At Infobip we dream big. Last year, over half of the world’s population interacted with businesses through the Infobip platform. It didn’t happen by chance: through 60+ offices on 6 continents, we are truly committed to helping our 200 000 enterprise clients reach and engage mobile users. And we are just starting. Join us in driving the continuous success of Infobip by creating products that our customers love.

Why is this role important at Infobip?

Infobip is looking for a experienced US GAAP accountant to support transition to US GAAP. You will be responsible for leading processes of developing accounting policies, manuals, delivering trainings and guidance in under US GAAP. You will supervise and work together with external consultants. The ideal candidate will have familiarity with SEC reporting requirements and the IPO process. You will report Group executive director for taxes and accounting and play a critical and strategic role at Infobip. We are open to receive applications anywhere in Europe.

Job Description

You know you are doing a good job when:
Establishing accounting policies and guidelines in accordance with US GAAP
Developing subject matter expertise to provide guidance across the organization
Directing and leading accounting teams in the development, implementation, and oversight of company-wide accounting policies and controls consistent with SEC, US GAAP and Sarbanes-Oxley compliance
Understanding the balance sheet & income statement impacts of new transactions to challenge or propose material accounting judgmental entries when relevant
Developing of documentations (Guidelines, Manuals) relevant for Group US GAAP reporting and maintaining it complete and up-to-date
Supporting on internal and external Audits including SOX Testing and internal controls
Supporting group wide finance projects
Qualifications

More about you:
Demonstrated knowledge of US GAAP
Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting, or Business; MBA or Masters in Accounting preferred
Certified Public Accountant (CPA) or ACCA qualification highly preferred
Minimum 6 years accounting and finance experience
Proven track record in a growth-oriented technology environment
Expert knowledge of financial and accounting activities, policies, and processes, including multi-currency consolidations, SEC reporting, and Sarbanes-Oxley
Big 4 experience is an asset
Experience in a multinational corporation desirable
Excellent oral and written communication skills in English
Ability to identify areas of improvement and to drive necessary action to completion
Demonstrate sound work ethics, respect and cultural sensitivity and awareness
Experience in Microsoft Dynamics is an asset
Additional Information

Why our employees choose us (and stay)?
Learn as you grow – Starting from an onboarding program, to internal education, education resources, e-learning to external educations, we invest heavily in employee learning and development.
Opportunity Knocks. Often. – Being a part of a growing company in a growing industry – we challenge you not to grow! Whether it’s horizontal, vertical, or angular, we want to support the path that you want to carve.
Never a dull moment – We work with powerful companies with great impact, which pushes us to work on the highest possible level. Work on uncharted challenges and push boundaries on a daily basis.
Great environment – Team spirit, passion, creativity and persistence are the drivers of our company.
Pay & Perks – Competitive salary, travel allowance, expatriate compensation packages for your business trips, rewards and holiday bonuses, a team taking care of all the equipment you need, team buildings and other organised activities, company library, organised sports, kitchen stocked with the usual suspects... Talk about a balanced lifestyle!

We are recruiting for this academic year!

Do you want to have a positive impact on young Autistic learners and excellent career progression?

Ambitious College at CONEL is proud to be an Ofsted ‘Good' college, supporting learners aged 16-25, in particular those who may have received all manner of set-backs in and outside of education. We are looking for SEN Learning and Behavioural Specialists, with a passion for working with young people to join us this academic year.

This position will be advertised throughout the academic year. Due to the nature of learning needs our pupils and learners do not have one point of entry and can be admitted into our settings at various dates throughout the academic year.

Your role as a Learning and Behaviour Specialist:
Provide day to day support, delivering 1:1, paired and small group teaching, and learner sessions using Positive Behaviour Support.
Supervise and support community-based learning and educational visits.
Use your creativity daily to support lesson plans through preparing materials and resources.
Support our learners to develop crucial life skills, meet their goals and aspirations through communication, independence and participation.
We are looking for empathetic and adaptable individuals, who thrive under pressure and have a natural ability to solve challenges. You will also need physical and emotional resilience to work with young people who sometimes present behaviours that challenge.

Why join us?
Competitive annual salary paid over 52 weeks and excellent salary progression within the role.
We are committed to CPD, where you can access a wide range of training and development opportunities support your personal and professionally development.
Annual staff recognition awards.
Cycle to work scheme up to £5000.
Season ticket loans.
A wide range of wellness programmes including: running club, cooking classes and pets cafe online.
Employee Assistance Programme, to help you balance your work, family, and personal life.
Access to free of charge physiotherapy.

About the role:

We are currently seeking an Electrical Engineer to form part of the electrical services team in order to provide specialist technical support and electrical safety support; within a specified geographical region, predetermined by your location.

The base location for this role is flexible across the whole London area
To undertake technical assessments and audits of Thames Waters electrical personnel, provide detailed technical reports and presentations, purveying the gravity of the needs in a persuasive manner.
Be a technical lead in projects and investigations. Champion Thames Waters Electrical safety rules policies and procedures
Delivery of LV electrical safety improvement projects.
Act as an Authorised Person (LV) across a geographical area issuing Permits to Work completed in line with the Electrical Safety Rules
Technical oversight and direction to newly qualified or appointed technicians
Practical and theoretical assessment of technical staff against company electrical policy and procedures.
Appoint technicians in line with job role and technical competence (Competent Persons Electrical assessment)
Follow up with field-based assessments, Identify Skill gaps or fade through electrical safety audits (SHE6 P)
Provide mentoring and coaching to address skill gaps some of which will require classroom based and practical teaching.
Leading local electrical technical community forums
Provide low voltage electrical technical support to our operations managers. Support around 12 line-managers with approximately 40 electrically skilled technicians, with the recruitment and development of their electrical staff
To be successful you will have the following skills and experience:

We are looking for an experienced apprenticeship-served industrial maintenance electrician with the potential to act as a focal point for support across multiple teams. You will have a good knowledge and understanding of health and safety requirements including electrical safety rules, although well encourage you to expand your broader knowledge and technical expertise through training and development opportunities.
An industrial biased electrician having had an indentured apprenticeship.
Experience with the development and mentoring of trainees. Involved with safety auditing process writing detailed persuasive reports.
City & Guilds 236 or current equivalent City & Guilds 2391, HND or HNC in Electrical engineering and ideally, although not essential an ECS card.
Time served electrical apprenticeship to NVQL3 or equivalent
Several years experience in Electrical Engineering / Maintenance field.
Good knowledge and understanding of relevant health and safety requirements, especially the Electricity at Work Regulations and their application to the business.
Ideally an awareness of Dangerous Substances and Explosive Atmosphere Regulations and electrical equipment for use in potentially flammable atmospheres
Good IT skills. Working knowledge of SAP beneficial
Good interpersonal skills are required, especially in managing relationships with technicians and operational management
Whats in it for you:

Fantastic opportunity for the right candidate to join an enthusiastic team guiding the electro technical standards and oversite of an industry leading water utility company.

The successful candidate will benefit from excellent training and mentoring, with personal development opportunities which can lead to exciting career progression.

Our competitive salary package includes an excellent contributory pension, 26 days holiday per year increasing to 30 with length of service and a wider benefits scheme. This includes an annual pay review, season ticket loans, voucher scheme giving you money off in major retail outlets, loyalty awards for continuous service plus much more, including our refer-a-friend bonus, where you can receive up to £1,000 for helping someone get a permanent position within the company.

Were also proud to be here for our local community, offering all our teams two days paid volunteer leave a year, as well as proudly supporting a lot of local events and charities.

Click here to view our full list of Rewards and Benefits

About us:

Thames Water is the UKs largest water and wastewater company. We make a daily difference to millions of customers by supplying 2.7 billion litres of world-class water to around 10 million homes.

As our world changes, the need to take care of our most precious resource is greater than ever, both locally and globally. Thats why, at Thames Water, every one of our actions, big and small, matters every day. Water is essential to daily life, and that means our business is always open. Were passionate about providing world-class tap water, now and for the future.

Were also turning waste into power, self-generating 20% of the energy we use and, in turn, doing our bit for the planet. Were reducing plastic waste by celebrating our tap water and rolling out an ambitious water fountain project. Were using our voice to lobby for change and partnering with WaterAid to provide clean water to the worlds poorest communities.

Together, were building a better future for our customers, our region and our planet.

Thames Water is a unique, rewarding and diverse place to work. If you join our team, youll enjoy fast-tracked career opportunities, flexible working arrangements and unparalleled benefits. Were also proud to be an equal opportunity employer, Stonewall Diversity Champion and Disability Confident Leader, welcoming individuals from all walks of life and leading the way with an award-winning mental health and wellbeing strategy.

Jonothan Bosworth Recruitment Specialists are currently working with an established technology company, as they look to bring on board an IT Support Technician to assist the business by providing technical support for any escalated calls and to assist other engineers when required.

Resolving tickets in a timely manner, and keeping the customer updated at all stages of the process is vital, so too is monitoring completion of backup jobs to ensure that tapes are changed.

Administering desktop OS images for laptops and desktops, working with O365 and assisting with issues whilst using and helping with basic Windows server requirements will result in an immediate interview request.

Ideal skills include; MAC OSX, Software packaging, OS deployment and Windows server.

THE CONCLUSION:

Technicians with a strong desire to work as an extension to an IT Support team, delivering high quality support services to multiple end users, experiencing different office environments will thrive in this role.

If you can maintain focus in a fast-paced environment, whilst listening and filtering the correct information from a request for support with a logical diagnostic approach we’d like to hear from you. The ability to clearly communicate and exhibit a courteous and professional attitude towards customers and a flexible approach to working hours when required will be of much interest.

Job Description Summary

The Workplace Specialist team are integral to the success of our Insurance strategy to ‘protect today and secure tomorrow’. Our colleagues represent and promote our flagship Scottish Widows workplace savings propositions across the financial services industry; engaging with consultants, advisers, employers, trustees, and end-customers, to build strong, lasting relationships to achieve business results. The location of this role is flexible.

Job Description

With over five million customers, and having celebrated our 200th anniversary in 2015, Scottish Widows is one of the UK’s most trusted Life, Pensions and Investments providers. We want to ensure this success continues and grows, and in Insurance and Wealth we contribute to this success by providing critical services to our customers and supporting them with their Insurance needs, whilst ensuring the customer is at the heart of our business.

The Workplace Specialist team are integral to the success of our Insurance strategy to ‘protect today and secure tomorrow’. Our colleagues represent and promote our flagship Scottish Widows workplace savings propositions across the financial services industry; engaging with consultants, advisers, employers, trustees, and end-customers, to build strong, lasting relationships to achieve business results.

The core purpose of this exciting new role is to help drive the development and understanding of the Scottish Widows workplace proposition as part of the Workplace Specialist team within the Insurance and Wealth Division of Lloyds Banking Group, exerting technical expertise and influence to increase the flow of new business and maintain close relationship with colleagues, intermediaries and our Bank relationships.

You'll be accountable for managing and driving targeted new business activity, supporting the development of our colleagues and working with other parts of the Group, in order to grow our funds under management and provide specialist support to deliver our workplace strategy.

What will you be doing?
Be considered a specialist and advocate for the workplace proposition both internally and externally.
Monitor and help drive workplace new business performance
In consultation with the sales leadership team, take ownership of creating and delivering an ongoing engagement programme for generalist BDMs/RSC’s in a way that supports the workplace growth ambitions of the business.
Provide technical and signposting support to generalist BDMs/RSC’s as they seek to develop their knowledge and skill base.
Facilitate the sharing of best practise and liaise regularly with specialist and generalist management to ensure key messages are successfully delivered.
In consultation with the Specialist Workplace Team ensure the Take to Market messages are creative, innovative and add value.
Provide a pivot point between the Distribution, Proposition and Marketing teams to ensure there is consistency and coherence of understanding around propositional changes and our development priorities.
Support key events and meetings and be available to support specialist colleagues where necessary.
Align with specified risk and compliance procedures and practices ensuring that you are operating within Lloyds Banking Group policies at all times.
Builds trust and customer confidence, presenting a professional image of Scottish Widow
Work closely with proposition colleagues to ensure intermediaries and colleagues see the best of our SW propositions and proposition colleagues benefit from a clear and reasoned assessment of the SW position in the market
So what about your Workplace Specialist skills?
Exceptional communication and presentation skills across all levels including new business pitching, with the ability to create a high impact experience in every interaction whether on a one to one or group basis.
Ability to design, implement and deliver an effective training programme and monitor its success in line with agreed measures set by senior management.
Ensure Workplace can optimise its distribution potential through whole of market distribution channels.
Detailed knowledge of the workplace market, the competitor landscape and developments therein and be able to articulate SW’s strengths versus competitors.
Experienced in consultative selling and have the ability to coach this methodology
Experience of working in a business development environment with front line experience of dealing with intermediary relationships.
Understanding of the intermediary market place including regulatory, technical and legislative issues.
Strong analytical skills proven through the ability to review a range of information and metrics and identify and prioritise appropriate actions
You’d get a benefits package that includes;
A performance related bonus
Generous pension contribution
30 Days leave plus bank holidays
A flexible cash pot (4% of base salary) to spend on benefits
Private health cover
We're dedicated to giving you opportunities and support to develop you both expertly and personally to optimise your potential.

As a new colleague, you’ll join us on our journey to build a 21st century bank that reflects modern Britain, and craft an inclusive culture where all colleagues feel encouraged and valued.

We're committed to building a workforce which reflects the diversity of the customers and communities we serve, and to building an inclusive environment where all our colleagues can be themselves and succeed on merit. We support the principles of agile working and are happy to consider flexible working arrangements. We're an equal opportunity employer and deeply value diversity within our organisation.

Together we make it possible.

****There is a degree of flexibility on the location of this role. The broad base salary banding across the UK is from £59,000pa to £79,000pa plus the above listed benefits. Salaries in the London area will be reflected towards the upper end of this bracket****

At Lloyds Banking Group, we're driven by a clear purpose; to help Britain prosper. Across the Group, our colleagues are focused on making a difference to customers, businesses and communities. With us you'll have a key role to play in shaping the financial services of the future, whilst the scale and reach of our Group means you'll have many opportunities to learn, grow and develop.

We're focused on creating a values-led culture and are committed to building a workforce which reflects the diversity of the customers and communities we serve. Together we’re building a truly inclusive workplace where all of our colleagues have the opportunity to make a real difference.

Special Needs Specialist Support
Protocol Education are looking for a Learning Support Assistant who specializes working with SEND students throughout all key stages.
Working with special needs is so rewarding with new exciting challenges that you can face every day. The school is based in North/East London and caters to students who have Moderate Learning Difficulties (MLD), Severe Learning Difficulties (SLD), Profound Multiple Learning Difficulties (PMLD) & Autistic Spectrum Condition (ASC).
The school appreciate career ambitious people as they have specific career ladder routes you can climb. The Ideal candidates would need to be:
oTeam player
oSafeguarding aware
oHappy to do personal care
oModerate SEN knowledge
oHappy take instruction
oBe resilient
oHappy to learn new skills
oHappy to help with personal care needs including feeding & changing

To be part of a school that takes pride in the benefit of working together to help students' development. As mentioned this role is all key stages, including key stage 5 students. The school measures and assesses the impact of the careers program on students by tracking their destinations and considering, on an individual basis, whether this represents a new challenge for them, and continues their journey towards Fulfilment, Belonging and Independence.
Protocol Education are fully in compliance with Agency Worker Regulations, ensuring you receive equal treatment for pay and conditions after a 12 week qualifying period. Please ask for further details
Successful applicants will be subject to satisfactory references, as well as possessing an up to date DBS or be willing to apply for one through Protocol Education.
If this role is of interest to you, or if you are considering another challenge in a SEND school, please contact Alecsandra @ Protocol Education on 0203 219 7740 or Alecsandra.frandes@protocol-education.com

-Has enthusiasm, motivation and creativity!

-Personalised consultant support
-Weekly pay
-Competitive pay-rates

The right candidate will;
-Supporting schoolwork under the supervision of the teacher.

- Ongoing CPD

We are pleased to announce, we are now supporting a well-known, trusted and respected provider of adult residential services in Farnborough with their permanent Waking Night Support Worker vacancies.
We have multiple Waking Night Support Workers roles available working within a small residential setting providing person centred care and support to those with learning and physical disabilities. Night shifts are available and our client will consider both full-time and part-time applicants. Alongside countless benefits and progression opportunities, our client is paying between £9.00 - £10.00 per hour.
These are permanent roles working 33-44 hours per week with an option of additional hours. Previous experience is not essential, so if you are looking to start your career as a Support Worker, we promise you a nurturing, supportive and fun working environment. If you are already an established Support Worker, our client will be able to offer progression into Senior Roles as and when the time is right. Our clients only requirement is you must be a car driver.
As a Waking Night Support Worker your main responsibilities will include:
Support people in accordance with their needs and wishes as detailed in their person centred support plans.
Demonstrate a commitment to the Safeguarding of Adults and to recognise and report any disclosure, suspicion or evidence of harm, risk of harm, abuse or neglect.
Accurately complete documentation that forms part of the their support plans and notes.
Support the clients in staying active, healthy and as independent as possible.
Attend training, including induction training, team meetings and individual supervisions.
Support people in all aspects of their daily living, for example, shopping, cooking and domestic.
In return, our client is offering a whole host of benefits, including:
Fully paid induction and training (NVQ level 2 and Level 3).
Ample training and development opportunities.
Pension scheme.
Free parking.
Free meals.
Excellent opportunities to progress within the organisation into Senior roles.
To take the next step in your career, apply today for a conversation with our Residential specialist Kieran Nowopolski.
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Salary: £9.15-£10.20 per hour
Experience:
Support Environment: 1 year (Preferred)
Licence:
UK Drivers (Required)
Location: Farnborough, Hampshire, South East England, England

Reliable & trustworthy

Specialist Support Officer (Mental Health)
Location: Camden, London

Salary: �25,500 per annum

Hours: 37.5 per week

8am – 4pm / 10 – 6pm / 1pm – 9pm on a rota basis

3 weeks weekends on followed by 3 weekends off

Contract: Permanent

Travel: May be required on an ad hoc basis

�

Are you an experienced and ambitious Specialist Support Officer looking for a new challenge?

We have a unique and exciting opportunity to be part of our assessment and support service in Camden. This facility caters to vulnerable adults with on-going high needs mental health. It consists of 15 self contained flats that our service users live in a fixed period.

�
The Role:
The role of Specialist Support Officer is to take lead responsibility in the application of defined specialist interventions (e.g. Social Work, Psychology, Drugs & Alcohol). You will have responsibility to advise the teams on changes to best practice whilst keeping new legislation in consideration. This role will play a vital part of providing support to customers through a key-worker and or group work system. You will have the ability to carry out interview assessments, support planning and risk assessments for customers with high support needs.
Benefits:
Annual leave

Pensions – One Housing is a sector-leader in the contributions we make to our colleagues’ pensions.

Buying and selling annual leave - We know that getting the balance right between work and home life is a big part of supporting our colleagues’ wellbeing.

Paid time off to volunteer in our communities.

Season ticket loans

A healthcare cashback plan – allowing you to claim back cash for you and your family’s routine healthcare.

Colleague recognition scheme – we let you know when you’ve done a #greatjob

One Academy – our innovative, in-house learning and development offering, designed to support with your personal and professional development.

Study leave – up to five days off per year to study toward a relevant qualification.

Career break - after three years’ continuous service.
Skills & Experience
Previous experience within in a Mental Health setting (essential) Knowledge of specialist assessment tools, methods and case formulation.
Knowledge of evidence based specialist interventions appropriate for community settings.
Experience of undertaking customer assessments, support planning and key-working with a clear outcome focus Knowledge about recovery model, peer support and coproduction procedures.
Experience working in community settings therapeutically, including assessments, designing interventions and demonstrating outcomes.
It is desirable you hold a BSc. in the relevant fields and an obtained MSc.

About us:
One Support, part of One Housing, provide support to a wide range of people, including young people, people with mental health problems, ex-offenders, and people with substance misuse problems. We provide services to people living in our properties, and also in their own homes – not necessarily those owned by One Housing. Our services include Floating Support, Supported Housing, Mental Health services and Young People’s services.

�

If this sounds like the opportunity for you, please apply!

As an organisation with a strong social purpose, One Housing works in some of the most diverse communities in the UK and their workforce reflects that. We understand the strength we gain from having and supporting our diverse teams. The different skills and experiences that our colleagues from different backgrounds bring to us allow us to make better decisions, consider different views and be an altogether more interesting and cohesive place to work.

We welcome applications from everyone, regardless of their background.

Support users by providing technical product support to enhance their overall product and service experience; through strong product and application knowledge assist users with technical queries enabling them to successfully configure, manage and complete their project.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Respond to user inquires through various communication channels including phone, email, chat, etc. regarding how to use the product and tool features to accomplish their specific tasks or milestones.
May assist users in the setup and configuration of tools and features within Datasite's technology products.
Using product knowledge, this role will provide support to our users who are experiencing simple or more complex issues with our products; troubleshoot and directly answer user questions to resolve the issues they are experiencing, and route issues that the Product Support Specialist is unable to resolve to the appropriate person or team for timely user resolution.
Provide educational tutorials and support on the platform's capabilities and functionality to users; Build positive relationships while being proactive in anticipating client needs.
Develop knowledge of industry and clients' use cases, in order to more fully understand background of support questions.
Capture client product support requests through internal workflow tools to ensure excellent user experience and support business metrics and reporting.
Participates in mentoring and guidance of less experienced colleagues.
Minimum Requirements (Education, Experience, Skills)
Degree preferred;
Strong technical aptitude and learning ability.
Previous experience in a client service or operational support environment.
Superior communication skills, especially in explaining technical terms in a way that non-technical individuals can understand.
High degree of independent problem solving and troubleshooting skills.
Ability to work well in a team collaboration environment.
Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.
Fluency in German & English (written & spoken)
Additional Information (i.e. schedule, hours)
Shift is Monday to Friday from 8:00am - 4:00pm

Want to join a team with a mission to improve and save lives?


We continually look for motivated and skilled individuals who are interested in supporting our customers – healthcare professionals who use our products to help patients and their communities.

We currently have the following opportunity available - please contact us for more details!

Description –


Support Specialists are primarily responsible for supporting the Elekta product family, associated third-party products and the people who benefit from their use.

The key activities of the role are supporting customers, business units and distributors with their product issues. Product support requests will be submitted to the support team via phone, email or customer portal. It is vital that all product issues are reviewed in a professional and timely manner with the clinical impact of the issue being identified as quickly as possible to determine the case priority.

The individual is expected to be first and foremost a good communicator with excellent interpersonal skills and dedication to our customers.

Level 1 support specialists are expected to have the appropriate passion and drive to develop their knowledge to enable them to progress to the next level of support specialist.

Responsibilities -
Primary resource for answering phone calls from customers, business units and distributors seeking product support
Troubleshoot product issues in a live clinical environment
Prioritize activities to ensure clinical system down problems receive immediate attention
Document all support activities in line with Elekta policies and procedures
Resolve and/or escalate cases as required. (spend no more than 30 minutes on an issue before requesting assistance from level 2 or level 3 support specialists)
Attend internal and external training as required. Demonstrate knowledge and skills obtained from training.
Visit customer sites (accompanied by senior staff) to investigate and resolve product issues
Prioritize and managing cases in an efficient and professional manner
Communicate with customers to understand the problem, localize the origin, and troubleshoot efficiently to bring about swift resolution
Clearly explain to the customer what steps are necessary to diagnose and resolve the problem so that they are fully aware of the implications and timescales involved
Escalating and seeking advice and assistance as required in order to ensure all issues are managed to a satisfactory resolution in the fastest possible time
Ensuring that all interested parties are aware of ongoing or escalating issues, progress being made and any plans that have been put in place
Ensuring that the customer is fully aware of the implications of any work being undertaken before that work commences.
Documenting and having that work accepted by the customer before leaving site or closing the case.
Be flexible to travel at short notice
Relevant Knowledge, skills and competencies -
Knowledge of PC/Network Computing is preferred.
Experience in medical imaging, linear accelerators and/or clinical use of radiotherapy products is desirable
Identifying any necessary training requirements and escalating these to management as needed.
At least one European language in addition to English (mother tongue level) Preferably German or French
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Ability to effectively interact with customers and colleagues
Ability to work in a team environment
Flexible and accommodating approach
Ability and desire to promote Elekta’s professional image
Can demonstrate outstanding customer care skills
Experience in a support environment (desired)
Location: Crawley, West Sussex, South East England, England

Job Description:
Heard of us?

We’re an award-winning bank; backing people to fulfil life’s hopes and dreams.

Now is your chance…

The Agreement Services team deal with administration tasks and on-going agreement maintenance on Asset Finance deals following set up. To be able to respond quickly and thoroughly to our internal colleagues’ requests and complete daily tasks on time and accurately. Ensuring we live up to our overall team key deliverables and within agreed Service Level Agreements (SLA’s), governance, compliance and regulations.

We attract talent; by being fully immersed in our business, influencing and understanding our short, medium, and long-term aspirations. We develop our people; to ensure they fulfil their hopes and dreams, whilst continuing to meet the needs and expectations of our dynamic business.

We are a high performing, high profile team. We have worked hard to establish ourselves as trusted advisors; providing the correct balance of knowledge and challenge which supports managers and leaders make the right decisions at difficult times.

When the time is right, we would love to welcome you to our Reading office. In the meantime you will be based remotely. You’ll be made to feel part of your new team by your Line Manager, who is The Agreement Services Team Leader, and colleagues through regular contact and virtual interaction.

What would your day look like?
Issuing welcome letters and providing documents to new customers
Printing, scanning and photocopying
Sorting agreement packs for boxing, archiving and storage
Sending statements and copy documents
Franking outgoing post, sorting and allocating incoming post
Maintaining spread sheets
Ad-hoc system and agreement amendments
What do we expect of you?
Good team player skills are essential with a track record of working within a dynamic team
Ability to work under pressure in a fast-paced environment
Great attention to detail
Works efficiently and looks for continuous improvements

What can you expect of us?
A friendly and flexible culture, synonymous with our proposition to our customers.
A growing organisation that defines itself as being nimble, lean and strong.
A drive for continuous improvement, which you will be empowered to get behind from day one.
A communicative, accessible and approachable ExCo.
And of course, you will be compensated competitively, with a good range of core benefits and bonus potential.

Still Curious?

Aldermore Group was formed by bringing together two very successful businesses, Aldermore Bank and MotoNovo Finance, under the First Rand umbrella. Whilst our parent company operates internationally from their HQ in South Africa, we are a UK-based financial services specialist that supports our customers across a range of products and services, with hubs throughout the UK, including London, Reading, Manchester and Cardiff.

Underpinned by our strategic blueprint, “backing people to fulfil life’s hopes and dreams”, we thrive upon saying “yes” to our customers. We respect the ingenuity of entrepreneurs and their startups; we give first-timers a leg-up onto the property ladder; and we open up the lending market to many.

This is where you come in. We are on a journey. A journey defined by a destination; to deliver on our purpose over the course of the next 3 to 5 years.

Join us today and we will make the same promises to you as an employee, as we do to each of our customers. We value your differences; welcoming applications from all sections of society. We continue to build an inclusive, empathetic and creative environment; where your views and contributions will inspire new ways of thinking.

Aldermore is an equal opportunities employer.

We do not accept speculative agency CVs. Any CV received by Aldermore will be treated as a gift and not eligible for an agency fee. PSL agencies should only send CVs if authorised to do so by HR.

Where a DBS check or CIFAS check is identified as necessary, all application forms, job adverts and recruitment briefs will contain a statement that an application for a DBS certificate or a CIFAS check will be submitted in the event of the individual being offered the position.

The Company:
Morningstar is a leading provider of independent investment research in North America, Europe, Australia, and Asia. The company offers an extensive line of products and services for individual investors, financial advisors, asset managers, retirement plan providers and sponsors, and institutional investors in the private capital markets. Morningstar provides data and research insights on a wide range of investment offerings, including managed investment products, publicly listed companies, private capital markets, debt securities and real-time global market data. Morningstar also offers investment management services through its investment advisory subsidiaries. The company has operations in 27 countries.

The Group:
Morningstar’s innovative products and services transform our high-quality data, independent research, and technological expertise into well-designed tools that delight our clients. The Customer Success group is the ambassador of our talents and investments aiming to provide our customer's with unique experiences while helping them reach their business success goals. The sales, service, product management and development teams collaborate with this group to provide clients with relevant products and bundled solutions.

Responsibilities:
• Proactively build effective client relationships, including the ability to anticipate and listen to our clients’ needs and be responsive. Achieve this by working closely with clients, our sales & product teams to deepen our client relationships, act as the key product expert and come to a better understanding of how they use and manage our products & data; and identify opportunities this may present for Morningstar.
• Proactively contribute to the renewal process and drive a strong renewal rate by continuously managing client satisfaction levels;
• Coordinating with technology and product management teams to refine existing client solutions; and working closely with sales teams to identify & evaluate potential upsell opportunities.
• Maintain and build strong client relationships by creating feedback loops that identify key areas for improvement in our service offerings, monitor risk, drive value-add activities, highlight new business opportunities and areas to improve customer satisfaction.
• Serving as a subject matter expert to Morningstar clients with a particular workflow.
• Maintaining a thorough understanding of our data, research and technology solutions and conducting regular business reviews with clients to provide updates on value-add activities from Morningstar and to ensure alignment between client success priorities and Morningstar success Plan.
• Ensuring key internal stakeholders (Strategic CSM, sales, support, data, product and technology managers) are aware of sensitive client information that impacts the overall relationship and to enhance existing client solutions.
• Working with our global data and product teams to efficiently deliver new data sets and product capabilities to clients.
• Acting as a product consultant, answering a variety of product-related questions, or collaborating with other internal resources as necessary to resolve questions and communicate to the client.
• Implementing an effective onboarding client experience to increase product & services adoption.
• Training home office representatives/solution-administrators/CSMs or Client Education teams to ensure end-users are supported in a coordinated manner.
• Work proactively to identify upsell and cross-sell opportunities through regular client interactions and relationship building activities.
• Acting as the point of escalation for the account (globally where applicable) and coordinating both internally as well as with the client to resolve escalated issues.
• Ensuring the voice of the customer and client satisfaction expectations are appropriately represented in product roadmap decisions and that the highest quality of service is offered to our clients.
• Enhancing our global service delivery model.

Requirements:
• Two to five years of client service, training or sales experience.
• A deep client service focus with strong technical, presentation, communication and consultative skills both written and oral.
• Excel in a fast-paced environment while still producing very high-quality, detail-oriented work.
• Proactive, strategic, and analytical thinker with a collaborative approach to problem-solving and project management.
• Ease in dealing with ambiguity; ability to create focus, coordination and keeping internal & external stakeholders on track.
• Ability to develop strong internal and external partnerships and relationships; take a collaborative approach; and work effectively across different business and functional areas.
• An intense desire to achieve client satisfaction and retention goals.
• Sound technical understanding of systems, data collection and delivery.
• Proven organizational and multi-tasking skills, as well as a thorough understanding of investment data, financial analysis and competitive landscape as well as market trends impacting our clients.
• Bachelor’s degree is required; an advanced degree is desirable.

Why we like working here:
• You will work in a Global team, together with both peers, product managers and other Morningstar employees all over the world.
• You will get to know the financial industry, our clients and their needs in a unique way.
• You will work and deep-dive in all parts of Morningstar data.
• You will dig deep into Morningstar’s analysis and research.
• You will have the chance to develop your technical skills and understanding.
• We have an inclusive, entrepreneurial culture where difference is embraced
• We love our teams, we work with amazing people.
• Casual dress code is the norm, no formal suits for us unless we have client meetings.
• We are in Shoreditch.

Please submit a resume and cover letter with your application.
Morningstar is an equal opportunity provider.

Job Title: Super-user / Success Specialist Salesforce CRM (EMEA ANZ)
Job Description:
Super-user / Success Specialist Salesforce CRM (EMEA ANZ)

Position Summary
*Role is 100% virtual/remote, you will have the option to use our offices if required*

A new position, integral to the overall Stanley Black & Decker (SBD) digital transformation strategy as we look to leverage technology in order to improve sales conversion and effectiveness and evolve and optimize the business planning process and maximize automation opportunities across the EMEA ANZ region.
The role will work closely with the CRM Manager and SBD Transformation teams in supporting both the roll-out and ongoing usage, development and maintenance of the Salesforce Lightning platform across the region. The role will combine both Salesforce.com platform development and maintenance alongside training and deployment across the EMEA ANZ region whilst building and managing relationships across markets.
Internal job position title: Salesforce Administrator (EMEA ANZ)

Responsibilities
Be a key advocate and ‘super-user’ for the Salesforce.com platform across the EMEA ANZ region within Stanley Black & Decker (SBD)
Understand key SBD business requirements (including organizational culture and structure) and how to effectively translate to the possibilities within the Salesforce.com platform
Unlock A.I. and automation potential across the Salsforce.com platform to support more efficient SBD business planning and strategy
Lead efforts to develop, train and expand use of the CRM platforms to optimize productivity and effectiveness resulting in enhanced user knowledge and competency with Salesforce.com
Be a key resource for user support across all EMEA ANZ markets including:
Report and dashboard creation across all user groups
Case / incident resolution (in conjunction with IT)
System enhancement identification
Overall support (including technical) for the Salesforce.com platform
Provide daily administration of the Salesforce.com database including (but not limited to) managing multiple user set-up, profiles and roles, customization of objects, fields, record types, page layouts and validations and workflows
Create and maintain documentation on processes, policies, application configuration and help / training related materials for users as database applications and functionality are developed
Support data management activities to ensure a high level of data quality and integrity is continuously maintained
Assist in development of governance and principles and help ensure adherence
Play a critical role during upgrades and releases to the system including testing, driving change management and executing deployments
Deliver effective training (including creation of relevant materials and media) to different user groups to support ongoing market launches (eg. Salesforce Lightning upgrade) and general functionality / platform development
Understand and define generic and individual user / market business requirements and effectively document and communicate to the IT team
Monitor the administration and resolution of issues by the IT team to ensure in line with defined limits
Build strong relationships with the managers of (and other key stakeholders within) the user group across markets to ensure proper and consistent use of the Salesforce.com platform in line with EMEA ANZ regional strategy
Share and re-enforce best practice across markets
Be ‘the voice’ of the user community and report back to management on commonly requested changes to the Salesforce.com application
Track and report back on platform usage and adoption to senior management
Monitor alignment and synergies across Salesforce.com platforms (Sales Cloud / Marketing Cloud / Commerce Cloud) through communication and collaboration with other relevant management teams and stakeholder groups
Assist with integration and usage of related CRM / Sales Enablement tools eg. Showpad and Altify

Qualifications
Minimum 3 years Salesforce.com / CRM system administration experience
Possession of extensive Salesforce.com platform knowledge and tactical skill, understanding how changes can positively impact the user community
Salesforce Administrator certification is preferred (SDM201)
Ability to build custom apps and objects, formula fields, workflows, customer views, dashboards and reports and other content
Ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders
Commercially orientated with an understanding of standard business processes, ideally, with experience of working with sales teams using Salesforce.com and selling into a retail environment
Strong communication and inter-personal skills in dealing with a range of internal customers including senior management stakeholders (in order to ‘sell to’ and ‘service’ the user group)
Ability to operate with confidence at different levels of management
Proven track record as a ‘Change Agent’ with direct experience of driving positive integration and adoption of Salesforce.com across multiple territories
Highly analytical and with a strong attention to detail
Have expertise in building reports and dashboards that deliver meaningful insights
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and experience in using other reporting software and tools eg. Tableau, SAP, BI, etc.
Proactive attitude and approach with an ability to identify ongoing process refinements aligned to business needs
Experience of building business cases to support systems development
Exceptional English communication and presentation skills (written, verbal)
Additional European language fluency a benefit
Excellent training skills (delivery and content creation)
Experience of working in a matrixed, global organization beneficial

Special Needs Specialist Support Based in Hackney

Protocol Education are looking for a Learning Support Assistant who specializes working with SEND students throughout all key stages.

oTeam player
oSafeguarding aware
oHappy to do personal care
oModerate SEN knowledge
oHappy take instruction
oBe resilient
oHappy to learn new skills
oHappy to help with personal care needs including feeding & changing

To be part of a school that takes pride in the benefit of working together to help students' development. As mentioned, this role is all key stages, including key stage 5 students. The school measures and assesses the impact of the careers program on students by tracking their destinations and considering, on an individual basis, whether this represents a new challenge for them, and continues their journey towards Fulfilment, Belonging and Independence.
Protocol Education are fully in compliance with Agency Worker Regulations, ensuring you receive equal treatment for pay and conditions after a 12 week qualifying period.
