Role Purpose

Our mission in Digital Delivery is to build a world class engineering team enabled by great technology and people.

Lead Developers are the most senior members of our development teams, responsible for influencing and implementing the technology used and enabling a high performing technical team. The role is accountable for the design of how applications work and the alignment to the overall Digital Platform Architecture.

Youll be involved at every step of the software development lifecycle while developing and learning new skills and contributing to the engineering culture here at NewDay. Our software has a huge user base and your code will be used by millions of customers.

Key Accountabilities
Build great software
Create new software features that meet the needs of our customers and improve the Digital Platform
Produce high quality code that meets internal quality standards, is maintainable and fulfils acceptance criteria
Ensure what the team produces is fit for purpose and necessary peer reviews have taken place
Provide overall leadership of technical designs, their discussion and required documentation
Innovate and encourage innovation. Be curious about technology and what can be done differently and make proposals, prototypes and contribute to new thinking
Deliver value continuously
Develop software features incrementally and influence product roadmaps to enable this
Ensure all development continuously integrates into working software using the defined CI/CD pipelines
Champion zero defects and short cycle times for engineering. Focus on finishing work to the definition of done across the team
Lead on the continuous technical improvement of development practices both within the team but propose changes that have impact across many teams
Lead a great development team
Work collaboratively in cross functional teams to develop fully working, tested and deployed software. Provide the leadership so that the team works together to achieve this.
Support more junior members in how to be part of an effective team
Communicate progress daily and be clear what help you need and can offer to others
Solve problems and ensure the team as a whole delivers
Contribute to technical discussions and the maintenance of technical standards
Mentor more junior team members.
Skills and Experience

ESSENTIAL
Experience in leading other developers to produce software
Experience of agile software development methodologies, such as SCRUM
Experience in CI/CD and the required tools and technology approach
Experience in distributed version control systems (e.g. Git). Specific experience is required in either git flow or trunk based development
Understanding of secure coding and cloud platform security
Understanding of design and architecture patterns and development principles
Strong experience in iOS development (with Swift) or Android development (with Kotlin)
Experience developing digital applications working in a cloud environment
Experience of mobile testing methods
Good understanding of mobile security
Experience of releasing to Appstores (iOS and Android) and Cloud environments
DESIRABLE
Experience in FinTech businesses
Experience in consumer lending or Credit Card issuing
Experience in managing technology operations, especially devops
Consulting experience in digital strategy, user Experience and/or interaction design
R&D and technology innovation
Experience of working with PaaS based architectures, ideally Azure, including full automation of builds and deployment
Personal Attributes
Ability to work unsupervised with a high level of self-motivation
Extremely flexible, must be able to deal with changing priorities
Focussed completely on solutions rather than problems.
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Ability to work under pressure and to challenging deadlines
Ability to present technical ideas and concepts in business-friendly language
Keen attention to detail
Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment
Diplomatic, emotionally intelligent, listens and is open to other points of view
Good analytical and problem-solving skills

We are MUFG. 360 years of heritage. A world-class set of businesses. And more than 180,000 employees in 50 markets. It’s no surprise that MUFG has grown to become one of the top five banks in the world. Our services include commercial banking, trust banking, securities, credit cards, consumer finance, asset management, and leasing. MUFG offers stability in an ever-changing market, providing services to high-profile clients worldwide.
Our vision? To become the world’s most trusted financial group. You’ll help us achieve it.
Overview of Department/Section
Currently there is an exciting opportunity for a hands-on experienced individual with detailed knowledge of the funcions associated with trade processing support. This role will support Fixed Income & Equity products traded in London with settlement in the APAC region.
Main Purpose of the role
Ensuring accurate and timely monitoring and settlement of all Fixed Income and Equity transactions in the Euroclear and the Domestic Market space. Products include, Corporates, Government Bonds, Repo, SBL, Cash Equity and Convertibles.
Key Responsibilities
In this role, you will be responsible for supporting the Settlement Pre-Matching across MUFG’s banking arm and securities business under a dual-hat arrangement. Under this arrangement, you will act and make decisions on behalf of both the bank and the securities business, subject to the same remit and level of authority, and irrespective of the entity which employs you. Others responsibilities include:
Resolving unmatched trades in Fixed Income and Equity products in the primary and secondary markets
The monitoring and resolution of unmatched trades related to bilateral Triparty Euroclear/Clearstream business.
Narration / investigation / resolution of cash and security breaks.
On-borarding of clients, understanding customer SSIs and required to ensure STP in the market.
Liaise with traders, legal and other support areas and counterparts.
Support the client business to process requests in a quick and efficient manner.
Minimisation of operational risk of the group, maintaining control over processes and challenging continuously.
Ensure desk procedures are kept up to date and improvements are made to improve efficiency.
Investigation and resolution of reconciliation breaks for all products supported by the Transaction Processing team covering all respective markets
Processing, Monitoring, reporting and resolution of all market borrow positions including any resulting mandatory recalls
Identification and process of pair off / partial opportunities with counterparties including the preparation of Payment/receipt instructions
Skills and Experience
5+ years financial markets experience predominantly based within top tier firms’ Fixed Income and Equity Settlements environments.
Detailed knowledge of the mechanics of Euroclear, Clearstream ,LCH and key global domestic markets is essential.
Understands the requirements linked to Triparty Repo/Security Lending.
Hghi level of experience in the DTC markets
High Level of experience in Stock Borrow/lend business, predominantly in the US market
Understands the operational risk framework and is acutely aware of the Front Office environment at play and how the team’ function complements it.
Experience of Euclid and SWIFT, in addition Gloss and Intellimatch experience would be useful.
Product understanding of Repo, margin/collateral process, Asset Servicing, International Equities
Excel, Outlook, Word skills.
Personal Requirements
Excellent communication skills able to articulate the need for change verbally and in written form.
Team player, proactive and flexible
Attention to detail.
Excellent organisation skills and ability to prioritise.
Ability to work in a pressured environment and to meet strict deadlines.
Professional attitude.
Excellent team player.
Proactive and flexible.
Good communication skills.
Understanding and appreciation of client/trader focus.
Outgoing, energetic personality, able to command respect and inspire others to raise the bar and follow in their example
We are open to considering flexible working requests in line with organisational requirements.

Biotecture is on the lookout for a Maintenance Operative with knowledge of horticulture and experience with water pumps / plumbing and electrics to join their fast-growing and close knit team. This role would be ideal for someone looking to become a specialist in supporting the infrastructure of maintaining living green walls and seeking to take on more responsibilities. Typically working in prestigious buildings predominantly around London and across the UK, your role will involve: Maintaining the irrigation rig and hydroponic systems in the field Early morning delivery of materials and equipment to site based teams. Ensuring horticultural quality of all living walls in the field & reporting issues to the team leader Pruning and carrying out ongoing maintenance of plants Maintaining a photographic record of the living wall Checking moisture levels, removing weeds, topping-up nutrients, treating for pests and diseases in line with instructions from horticultural quality manager & replanting as necessary Ensuring there are no leaks on walls and plant rooms Maintaining guttering, flashings and trims.
About You
Experience with irrigation and maintenance of irrigation
Full clean Drivers License
Practical experience troubleshooting issues with irrigation systems
Excellent customer service skills
Good communication skills (written & verbal)
Passionate and dedicated Sound & demonstrable knowledge of horticulture
Experience of water pumps / plumbing and electrics on both installation, maintenance and design of irrigation systems
Excellent knowledge of installation and maintenance of irrigation to both commercial and private clients (desirable)
Ideally, hold the following active tickets; IPAF, first aid PASMA, spraying including PA1 and PA6a.
Ability to work under own initiative, and ability to work flexible hours.
Candidates with previous experience in or job titles including Irrigation Maintenance Operative, Horticulture, Field Maintenance Operative, Horticultural, Maintenance Assistant, Living Wall Operative, Living Wall Gardener, Irrigation Consultant, Horticulturist, Gardener, Irrigation Specialist may also be considered.

Position: Waking Night Support Worker
Company: SeeAbility (Charity for Learning Disability and Autism)
Salary: £12.50 per hour & excellent benefits and training (equivalent to £24,375 per annum)
Details: Full time, Permanent
Your life doesn't stop at 9pm and neither does it for the people we support. Whether its going out, making a tasty meal for a friend or just catching up on a box set, it's our mission to encourage people with disabilities to challenge what they expect from life, from themselves and from wider society. As a Support Worker, your role in enabling the people we support to achieve the extraordinary each and every day will be invaluable.

Job Title:

2nd Line Support Analyst

Job Description:

This is an exciting time to join dentsu as we focus on becoming a 100% digital economy business in 2020 through content, media and commerce. We are well placed to build capability, scale and sustainable growth as a high performance business. Our strategy is driven by our unique culture with one vision (to innovate the way brands are built), one set of values and a unique operating model which drives collaboration, client focus and attention.

Job Description:

You will be responsible for providing platform, data and technical support of the new internal bespoke media applications. This individual will work with other members of the support team to deliver high quality solutions to support our end users and will act as a point of escalation for the Service Desk and working closely with 3rd Line.

This role will report directly to the Second Line Support Manager and will be part of the EMEA Regional Hub team supporting the Media Ecosystem adoption across the region for all the Dentsu Aegis Network agencies, regionally and globally.

The Second Line Support Analyst needs to be reactive to the requests and sometimes demands of our users to ensure that the best service is provided. To be successful in the role, a strong enthusiasm and a desire to learn and apply technical information in a fast-paced, demanding work environment is required.

Role & Responsibilities:
To provide second line platform, data and technical support, answering support queries via phone, email, ticketing system in a timely, polite, and efficient fashion
Adhering to the timeframes defined within the SLAs and SLOs
Provide Support between 9.00am - 5.30pm
Analyse and resolve assigned 2nd line support tickets regionally and globally
You will be the escalation point for any 1st line activities that require attention and stepping in for the Service Desk where necessary
Perform proactive maintenance on supported systems where required
Monitoring bespoke internal media tools
Participate in troubleshooting platform outages or performance issues
Provide regular updates to users and the Service Desk Team lead on progress with items, escalating issues where required
Review and updating knowledge base and product documentation
Undertake projects, completing assigned tasks as necessary to the agreed timescales
Technical requirements:
At least 2-3 years in a platform support role
Experience in supporting data platforms, data connections and API, preferably in a media organisation
A reasonable understanding of data and the ETL process
IT Service Management systems; ideally Service Now, JIRA or similar
Use of Adverity, Trifacta, DBeaver, Tracker3000, PowerBI, Tableau or similar
Familiar with SharePoint and MS Office 365
Relevant certifications ITIL V3 Foundation or similar
Professional requirements:
You will be passionate about quality customer service and have a problem-solving mindset
Strong technical support experience to ensure a seamless service for users
The ideal candidate will have the ability to prioritise, multi-task and work well under pressure
Understanding of how data works and managed
Must have excellent written and verbal communication skills
The ability to work individually and collaboratively
Positively contribute ideas and feedback to help the team grow
Raise application awareness - create promotional material, maintain documentation and conduct training sessions
Due to the nature of the role, it is important for you to be punctual, adaptable and flexible to ensure that issues get resolved within the required timeframes
What you’ll get from us

dentsu is a fantastic place to work with many great benefits on offer including 25 days’ annual holiday, Pension, Cycle to Work Scheme, and get your Birthday day off!

Not only is it an incredibly fun place to work but as part of a multinational organisation there are many opportunities to advance your career within the wider business once you have proven yourself.

About dentsu

dentsu international is headquartered in London and operates in 145 countries worldwide with more than 45,000 dedicated specialists. dentsu is Innovating the Way Brands Are Built for its clients through its best-in-class expertise and capabilities in media, digital and creative communications services.

Our values and behaviours:

Agile – Anticipate business needs, continuous process improvement, be flexible whilst maintain high standards

Pioneering – Being constantly curious, be bold in challenging the status quo, support a culture of openness

Ambitious – Strive for excellence, drive hard to achieve, learn from experiences

Responsible – Uphold the highest levels of integrity, lead by example, be courageous in raining concerns

Collaborative – Operate as one team locally and globally by sharing best practice and following standard practices and processes

Inclusion & Diversity

We value the strength diversity brings to our business and are working hard to build a more inclusive workplace through partnerships with Stonewall, Business Disability Forum and Business in the Community’s race and gender equality campaigns. We are happy to discuss all flexible and agile approaches to working for all our roles – we can’t promise we will be able to offer you everything you want or need but we do promise to discuss it with you openly and honestly.

If you have any reasonable adjustment needs arising from a disability or medical condition to fully participate in the recruitment process, please discuss this with the recruiter who contacts you.

Role Purpose

NewDay are looking for Senior API Engineers with expertise and passion for curating API products and solutions. Senior API Engineers seek a wide variety of problems and situations as we continue innovate and develop products. We expect engineers to be proficient in algorithms, problem solving, and crafting scalable, resilient, and fault-tolerant architectures. This includes being a specialist in one or more programming languages. Effective communication is an attribute in any engineer as you and your team move in a fast-paced development environment.

What You'll Do
Architect, build, and deliver high-quality API products and solutions
Collaborate with engineers, product owners, and other colleagues to seek exciting and ambitious problems for delivering value
Write clear, maintainable code that will scale
Learn, grow, and support engineering peers with different domain expertise through code reviews
Drive the best engineering practices within the team
Who You Are?
You know how to write readable, idiomatic, and maintainable C#
You understand design patterns and API design
You care about quality and know what it means to ship high quality code
You see yourself as a T-shaped engineer, but you major in C#
You value team success over personal success
You are diplomatic, emotionally intelligent, have an ability to listen and are open to others points of view
You possess strong written and verbal communication skills.
Basic Qualifications
Proven record of implementing high quality software solutions
Experience systems in the cloud. We use Azure, we love serverless and containers
Experience implementing API products
Experience of agile methodologies
Preferred Qualifications
Experience in FinTech
Experience in consumer lending or credit card issuing
Strong product focus and acumen, especially API engineering. We like APIs.
Experience with building highly scalable API products that meet the high demands of millions of users
Launched APIs to both internal and external consumers

Role Purpose

Our mission in Digital Delivery is to build a world class engineering team enabled by great technology and people.

Developers are responsible for building new software features that enhance the Digital Platform and improve our customers experience. Youll be involved at every step of the software development lifecycle while developing and learning new skills and contributing to the engineering culture here at NewDay. Our software has a huge user base and your code will be used by millions of customers.

Key Accountabilities
Build great software
Create new software features that meet the needs of our customers and improve the Digital Platform
Produce high quality code that meets internal quality standards, is maintainable and fulfils acceptance criteria
Review the code produced by other team members to ensure is fit for purpose
Take ownership of technical design discussions and create the right level of documentation
Innovate. Be curious about technology and what can be done differently and make proposals, prototypes and contribute to new thinking
Deliver value continuously
Develop software features incrementally
Continuously integrate code changes into working software using the defined CI/CD pipelines
Zero defects and short cycle times. Focus on finishing work to the definition of done
Propose improvements to the development process to constantly increase the flow of value and maintain quality
Be part of great development team
Work collaboratively in cross functional teams to develop fully working, tested and deployed software
Support more junior members in how to be part of an effective team
Communicate progress daily and be clear what help you need and can offer to others
Solve problems and ensure the team as a whole delivers
Contribute to technical discussions and the maintenance of technical standards
Mentor more junior team members
Skills and Experience

ESSENTIAL
Experience in leading other developers to produce software
Experience of agile software development methodologies, such as SCRUM
Experience in CI/CD and the required tools and technology approach
Experience in distributed version control systems (e.g. Git). Specific experience is required in either git flow or trunk based development
Understanding of secure coding and cloud platform security
Understanding of design and architecture patterns and development principles
Strong experience in iOS development (with Swift) or Android development (with Kotlin)
Experience developing digital applications working in a cloud environment
Experience of mobile testing methods
Good understanding of mobile security
Experience of releasing to Appstores (iOS and Android) and Cloud environments
DESIRABLE
Experience in FinTech businesses
Experience in consumer lending or Credit Card issuing
Experience in managing technology operations, especially devops
Consulting experience in digital strategy, user Experience and/or interaction design
R&D and technology innovation
Experience of working with PaaS based architectures, ideally Azure, including full automation of builds and deployment
Personal Attributes
Ability to work unsupervised with a high level of self-motivation
Extremely flexible, must be able to deal with changing priorities
Focussed completely on solutions rather than problems.
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Ability to work under pressure and to challenging deadlines
Ability to present technical ideas and concepts in business-friendly language
Keen attention to detail
Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment
Diplomatic, emotionally intelligent, listens and is open to other points of view
Good analytical and problem-solving skills

Job Title: Specialist Technician (Learning and Teaching): 3D Milling and Cutting
Job Description:
In this key role, you will provide professional expertise, guidance and advice and contribute to the delivery of teaching and learning activities within the College. The position is to cover and supervise the digital fabrication resource at Golden Lane site which includes Laser cutter and CNC routers and knowledge of Adobe Illustrator and Rhino 3D modelling software. They will also be required to facilitate and support student making using both hand and machine techniques and be confident in the use of traditional workshop equipment, along with other workshop disciplines as required.

You will also be responsible for ensuring the learning environment is adequately equipped, whilst supporting and supervising a diverse range of learners in using various equipment.

You will provide support for student learning, informal and formal training and instruction and the development of proficiency with highly specialised techniques.

If you have any queries you may contact the LCF Staffing Team, email: vacancies@fashion.arts.ac.uk.
Why choose us?
University of the Arts London is a vibrant world centre for innovation, drawing together six Colleges with international reputations in art, design, fashion, communication and performing arts.
London College of Fashion is extremely proud to be a global leader in fashion education, research and consultancy. Much of its success is down to its dedicated employees, and you will play an important role in shaping future creative professionals, and impact on the future of so many creative industries.
London College of Fashion, UAL is undertaking an unprecedented programme of change. In 2023 we will be consolidating our existing six sites into a new purpose built campus as part of a new education and cultural district on the Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park. Ahead of this move, we welcome applications from candidates who live in and around East London, as well as from those keen to join us on this exciting and unique opportunity in our College’s history.
Your profile
Ideally with a degree or an equivalent qualification and industry experience and ideally candidates should possess a degree level qualification.
A motivated, creative individual with high levels of technical competence and a dedication to technological development.
With good communication skills, you will be able to contribute crucial input to student concept and expressive/ creative intention, including giving feedback to students and helping with student formative assessments, with reference to appropriate learning outcomes of the course or project. The post holder should be proactive, well organised, command excellent interpersonal and supervisory skills in addition to a strong sense of teamwork and collaboration
UAL is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive university - a place where we all can be ourselves and reach our full potential in our work, learning and creative practice. We offer a range of family friendly, inclusive employment policies, flexible working arrangements and Staff Support Networks. We welcome applicants from diverse backgrounds, including race, disability, age, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, religion and belief, marriage and civil partnership, pregnancy and maternity, and caring responsibility.
Candidates are advised to submit applications early.

Job Title: Interim Microsoft Service Technical Specialist - IT
Job Description:
What's involved with this role:
Start date 4 January 2021. A Microsoft Service Technical Specialist is required to perform technical administration, technical implementation of infrastructure projects, low level design, maintenance functions and documentation creation for Marie Curie’s Microsoft infrastructure services. Core to the role is the design, administration and continual improvement of Marie Curie’s Microsoft services including, but not limited to; Azure, Active Directory, Office 365, Intune, Windows operating systems (server and desktop), Hyper-V, Microsoft Dynamics and System Center Configuration Manager (SCCM). The role will also contribute into the Continual Service Improvement of services, with support from the IT Infrastructure Services Manager. The Microsoft Services Technical Specialist will be responsible for enacting work to bring Marie Curie’s Microsoft infrastructure to a high level or resilience, flexibility and efficient operation, and then maintain that status. Key accountabilities:
Manage, administrate and continually improve the Microsoft infrastructure services including; Azure, Active Directory, Office 365, Intune, Windows operating systems, Hyper-V, Microsoft Dynamics and SCCM
Networking for the above services such as management and administration of ExpressRoute, Azure Networking/Routing, DMZ configuration and best practices, Windows Server networking roles and fundamentals of firewall management
Operation of infrastructure services to organisation security standards, maintaining personal security awareness and contributing to security improvement
Provide expert advice regarding the development and improvement of the Microsoft infrastructure services
Experience in the design, configuration and deployment of Microsoft Intune solutions including User Management, Service Administration, Application Creation and Deployment/Assignment, Conditional Access, Device/Profile Management and Mobile Application Management
Experience of managing mobile devices and distribution of applications (e.g. O365 connectors, Skype for Business, other sandbox applications) for both iOS and Android OS within Intune
With support from the IT Infrastructure Services Manager, enact governance of Marie Curie’s Microsoft IT infrastructure services – Includes implementing and overseeing the measurement of; activities, events and quality criteria (e.g. servers created to specified requirements)
Produce and maintain documentation pertaining to; configuration, processes and technical architectures of Marie Curie’s Microsoft infrastructure
Provide ‘hands on’ technical expertise.

Your availability to work either immediately, or at short notice.

Excellent analytical skills, with the ability to see the root causes of issues and problems, and resolve them, and map improvements.
Excellent IT infrastructure administration and support skills.

Technical analysis skills with the ability to quickly gain a detailed understanding of complex technical systems and how these systems support the organisation.

Our mission is to break down the barriers of today to release the potential of tomorrow. Join us today and release yours.
About this role
Sales Specialist is responsible for building client relationships in order to identify opportunities, develop pipeline and successfully achieve regional sales targets.

Maintaining a broad architectural knowledge, having opinions across all areas of BT Specialist Portfolio (Mobile, Voice, Networking, and IT), and understanding this portfolio at a sufficient level is required to generate quality opportunities, and to be able to differentiate our offerings against those of our competition. For the portfolio you are accountable for, you will be expected to have a deep architectural knowledge of your area of specialism, along with the associated systems and processes by working with manufacturer partners, internal product managers and portfolio groups.

You will be expected to use skills and knowledge to influence the strategic direction of the EE and BT propositions portfolio based upon customer market knowledge, and effectively articulate our business strategy and that of the wider BT.

This role will be responsible for following and understanding the latest trends and developments in our industry worldwide and be able to present and share knowledge to colleagues to improve others learning, as well as delivering campaigns and events to help deliver revenue growth targets.

Particular emphasis will be placed on acting as an ambassador both in the external market and within internal stakeholders, demonstrating best in class sales behaviour and delivering excellent customer experience results

This role will also be accountable for working with finance and Pricing to understand the P&L in detail for the customer solutions being sold to ensure margins on all deals are maximised and component pricing parameters are aligned to market expectations.

You'll have the following responsibilities
Accountable for managing, delivering and exceeding all Sales targets, based on SOV GM and Total revenue for a defined base of customers across the region
Accountable for building solutions that meet and exceed customers’ business needs, delivering RoI and that are the most profitably built for BT
Accountable for maintaining a broad architectural knowledge and have opinions on leading and emerging technologies, using this to influence both customers and internal stakeholders
Accountable for driving a high level of customer satisfaction and advocacy across the customer base for the region through personal activity and leveraging the wider teams
Accountable for influencing to create incremental sales opportunities across the EE and BT portfolio, develop pipeline and successfully achieve required sales targets
Accountable for creating a pipeline three times the size of SOV target to ensure correct cover
Accountable for successfully developing and driving sales plans with Account Managers, using agreed methodologies, to retain existing BT business and develop and grow new revenue for BT
Accountable for driving the attachment of service to product sales ensuring the mix is a rich
Accountable for driving timely service renewals within customer base
Accountable for developing and maintaining an accurate forecast and qualified /robust pipeline
Accountable for defining and developing peer and executive relationships with the virtual teams and wider BT and EE
Working with finance and Pricing to understand the P&L in detail for the customer solutions being sold to ensure margins on all deals are maximised and component pricing parameters are aligned to market expectations

You'll have the following skills & experience
Strong analytical skills, to include forecasting, pipeline, achievement, P&L details, detailed understanding of customer trading & buying process/cycles and the ability to analyse competitor proposals as and when required
Ability to engage at a board level with customers to strategically position BT, its offering and competitive advantage
Excellent financial and commercial acumen
Strong analytical skills
Be resilient and able to achieve against challenging targets
Ability to plan, forecast and report against sales plan and targets
The ability to work with the minimum of supervision, be part of a team and present a quality image
Be willing to travel and work from customer and other BT sites
Experience you would be expected to have:
Proven track record of delivering against targets within a sales role
Managing change, aligning and prioritising multiple demands
Excellent communication, presentation and interpersonal skills with strong influencing and negotiation skills
Experience of using an industry recognised sales methodology
Familiarity with the relevant specialist sales portfolio

Benefits
At BT, we entertain, educate and empower millions of people every single day. We’re a brand built on connecting people – whether that’s friends, family, businesses or communities. Working here, you’ll receive an attractive salary and a range of competitive benefits, but – more than that – you’ll be joining an ambitious organisation with a culture of togetherness, collaboration and inclusivity, that takes a genuine and proactive interest in your progress and development. Benefits of working for BT include:

• Competitive salary and on-target bonus plan

• World-class training and development opportunities

• 25 days’ annual leave (not including bank holidays)

• Discounted broadband, mobile and TV packages

• Car allowance (dependent on your role)

• Share option and pension scheme programmes

• Automatic enrolment into our ‘Sales as Profession’ community

• Flexible benefits to fit around you
About BT

BT has a key role in British society, fostering change and leading technology innovation. From delivering the Olympics, to supporting the emergency services, to investing more into research than any other UK technology company, we take pride in everything we do - and in the people who work here.

We're now a global company operating at the forefront of the information age, employing 90,000 people in 180 countries. And we're on a mission. Guided by our core values of Personal, Simple and Brilliant our goal is to help customers, communities and businesses overcome barriers and release their potential.

So, if you're interested in the power of potential, why not join us today and release yours? You can read more here about what it's like to work at BT

How to Apply

It's easy to apply online; you just need a copy of your up-to-date CV and to follow the step-by step process. Don't worry if you need to make changes - you'll have the opportunity to review and edit your work on the final page. We look forward to receiving your application!

Job Title: Support Technician Cross College Central Loan Stores
Job Description:
We are looking for someone who can assist with the loan and maintenance of a variety of equipment to students across 3 Art and Design colleges in London. This role will require you to travel between sites and on occasion assist in the studio or classroom with basic AV troubleshooting.
In this technical role, you’ll support the day-to-day operation of the Central Loan Store (CLS) facilities at Camberwell, Chelsea or Wimbledon College of Arts (CCW) by staffing the equipment collections/returns desk during our opening hours, accurately maintaining the department databases, ensuring that equipment is returned in good order. You must adhere to the loan policy whilst also managing the student experience sensitively.
This role is service orientated and requires some technical knowledge of specialist photographic/video and audio-visual equipment and accessories. Knowledge of how to troubleshoot a range of equipment issues would be an advantage.

Why choose us?
University of the Arts London is a vibrant world centre for innovation, drawing together six Colleges with international reputations in art, design, fashion, communication and performing arts.
Every position within the University plays an important part in shaping future creative professionals, and impacts on the future of so many creative industries. You will get to be a part of this future by transferring your specialist knowledge on to other keen creatives whilst developing your own skills.
In return, University of the Arts London offers generous leave, an attractive pension and a commitment to your continuing personal development and training in an environment that encourages excellence, creativity and diversity.
Your profile
You will be approachable and knowledgeable and have the ability to work independently and also as part of a team and be able to deal with student enquiries quickly in a busy environment, ensuring that the experience of each customer is positive and satisfactory. Excellent timekeeping, communication, interpersonal and IT skills are essential as is the ability to provide oral and written information clearly and concisely.

If you have any queries about this role that are not covered in the documentation, please contact Christine Crouch, Staffing Administrator, email: jobs.ccw@arts.ac.uk.
UAL is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive university - a place where we all can be ourselves and reach our full potential in our work, learning and creative practice. We offer a range of family friendly, inclusive employment policies, flexible working arrangements and Staff Support Networks. We welcome applicants from diverse backgrounds, including race, disability, age, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, religion and belief, marriage and civil partnership, pregnancy and maternity, and caring responsibility.
Candidates are advised to submit applications early.

The Bank of England is the UK's central bank. Our mission is to deliver monetary and financial stability for the British people.

The Bank of England is a diverse organisation. Each of its 4,000 plus people are committed to public service and dedicated to promoting the good of the people of the United Kingdom by maintaining monetary and financial stability.

Banking, Payments and Innovation Directorate supports the Bank’s mission to maintain monetary and financial stability by using and sharing its expertise to: develop and operate resilient and efficient banking, payment and custody services; set and influence policy; and to promote innovation.

We are at the heart of the Bank both in terms of our core role in Monetary and Financial Stability, and the wide range of internal stakeholders we collaborate with. BPI has a lead role in one and a significant role in four of the Bank’s strategic priorities. The variety and immediacy of the work we do means we are one of the most outward facing and fast moving areas of the Bank, operating the UK's high value payments system (the Real Time Gross Settlement System and CHAPS), maintaining the Bank’s readiness to provide Emergency Liquidity Assistance to banks and other financial institutions, and acting as the 'bank' within the Bank of England for government, UK CCPs and other central banks.

Department Overview

The Collateral Management and Custody (CMC) team sits within the Central Banking Operations Division of Banking, Payments and Innovation (BPI) Directorate.

CMC currently comprises; 3 Operations Technical Analysts, 1 Team Leader, 9 Technical Specialists and 10 Team members.

Whilst based in the BPI Directorate, the team’s work has strong links with the Bank’s Sterling Markets Division, Customer Banking Division and regularly interacts with other financial institutions.

Job description
The Collateral Management and Custody (CMC) team is responsible for the settlement of collateral in support of the Bank’s Sterling Monetary Framework (SMF) and other Official Operations; settlement of custody trades on behalf of other Central Banks, the Debt Management Office (DMO), and other customers; and the asset servicing of the associated securities holdings.

The team has close links to the Bank’s Sterling Markets Division and Customer Banking Division and regularly interacts with other financial institutions.

You will be expected to learn all aspects of the work of the operational roles associated with the above responsibilities in order to provide flexibility and staff coverage.
Supporting and monitoring of daily operations, to ensure the settlement of the Bank’s official operations, to provide liquidity to the market during both normal and stressed conditions through regular operations; and to provide effective asset servicing and custody services to our Clients. Help coordinate testing of the Bank’s contingency facilities to ensure smooth settlement in all operational scenarios.
Produce and present management information on the values and volumes of the work of the team, identifying trends in the data.
Being a source of technical expertise in all aspects of the team’s work; both process and systems related, in order to provide support and guidance for team members in resolving any issues or queries that arise. Providing training and mentoring to team members as well as providing feedback on performance.
Managing change initiatives impacting CMC’s business operations and systems from analysis through to delivery, both in response to Markets’ requirements, technology and the team’s own initiatives. Technical Specialists will be expected to complete the requirements for changes and improvements to CMC’s settlement systems and help implement changes through testing and reviewing test output. Liaising with CMC’s User Acceptance Team, Business Support Team and system vendor would be needed to ensure successful implementation of changes.
Working with the other CMC Technical Specialists and the team to identify operational risks and contributing to the production of risk reporting both within CMC reporting and also wider divisional risk reporting.
Operational excellence and continuous improvement; identifying and driving improvements within CMC as well as promoting a culture of continuous improvement among the team members.
Relationship and Stakeholder management; meeting with our clients and custodians to discuss existing and new business. This includes internal Bank customers as well as external clients from Central Banks to SMF participants and also I/CSDs to other third parties.
Role Requirements

Essential Criteria
Strong organisation and workload management skills including the ability to prioritise and switch between tasks to meet deadlines
Ability to work accurately and to tight (sometimes urgent) deadlines
A proven track record of problem solving including identifying and providing resolutions or recommendations
Good written and oral communication skills, with the ability to adapt as necessary in order to build strong relationships with a range of internal and external stakeholders
A self-starting and pro-active attitude
The ability to work both independently and within a team environment
Desirable Criteria
Experience of using settlement systems, including CREST, Euroclear, Clearstream, RTGS, SWIFT, Fedwire or DTCC;
Asset servicing experience;
Collateral processing and settlement experience;
Project/change management experience;
Knowledge of the Bank’s SMF and other operations.
Experience managing and delivering change or small projects, from the analysis of requirements through to testing and implementation.

As a Technical Specialist, you will provide high-level expertise to programmes in Francophone and Anglophone Africa and South Asia. You will have a strong track-record in providing technical assistance on health financing and developing the capacity of local counterparts/institutions.
Responsibilities:
The Technical Specialist (health financing), will provide technical support in health financing to Options’ portfolio of programmes in low and middle income countries, including in Francophone and Anglophone Africa and in South Asia. The post-holder will provide technical assistance to governments and civil society organisations, directly and through the long-term programme teams. S/he will support the design and implementation of approaches to leverage domestic financing for health as well as promoting the effective and efficient management of resources to ensure sustained uptake of services. Designing new concepts and programmes and strategically engaging with current and potential funders is an inherent part of this role.
Person specification:
An MSc or PhD in health financing or health economics or relevant field
Significant experience of delivering technical work on health financing across Africa and/or Asia
Strong understanding of public financial management in developing countries and experience strengthening the annual planning and budgeting process
Substantial experience of providing remote and in-person technical assistance to counterparts, across a range of overseas programmes
Substantial experience of developing new concepts and technical design of programmes
Fluency in written and spoken English and French
Benefits:
Options offers a comprehensive benefits package including generous annual leave allowance, season ticket loan, cycle to work scheme and a performance related bonus scheme.

Job Title: Diversity and Inclusivity Employer Branding Specialist
Job Description:
£72000 per annum plus 6,000 car allowance
An exciting time to join this Global Leader in Consumer Electronics within their European Human Resources Team as an Organisational Culture & Employer Branding Manager, focussing on Diversity and Inclusion, championing core values, enhancing internal communications and building an Employee Value Proposition (EVP) capable of attracting and retaining top talent. You must have strong communication skills including written English to be able to put together copy writing materials.
You will have worked in an employee brand development position and will have a proven understanding of the core principles of employer branding, employee engagement and marketing (including digital / social media), Diversity & Inclusion subject matter expertise – including strategy development and execution. Exceptional communication and stakeholder engagement skills, with the ability to build and foster relationships and collaborate together with customer service ethics. Highly organised and proactive with project, vendor and budget management experience and strong analytical skills, excel and a communication platform such as Poppulo.
The company is beginning to build and implement a new regional approach to Employer Branding, drawing on global expertise to enhance our organisational culture and the overall employee experience. Life with this company is highly exciting, fast paced and demanding yet exceptionally rewarding and this role requires strong cultural intelligence, perseverance and resilience, and offers the potential to impact at a regional level, and also to chip in to global projects.
We need to grow a strategy to deliver on our long term vision to make us a front-of-mind employer of choice in Europe who top talent desire a career with, employees are inspired to stay with and competitors aspire to be like!
You will enable us to
Develop a consistent approach to employer branding and organisational culture across Europe in partnership with key partners*
Create a unified & authentic European employer brand and culture proposition that:
are in harmony with corporate/consumer brand, core values and future vision.
can be adapted by each subsidiary to suit local markets
Key partners include:
HQ teams, Global Marketing Centre and Global Culture Team
Other regional HR teams (e.g. North America)
European Marketing, PR and CSR teams
Subsidiary HR teams (17 subsidiaries in 33 countries) across Europe and our Shared Service Centre (SSCE) in Romania
Local & European employee representative bodies
The Employer Branding project is strategically very important to our European organisation as we want to raise our employer profile externally and attract the best talent. It is also highly valuable internally, as we look to enhance our culture and evolve the solid foundations HR have been building.
As well as this we need to continue to enhance organisational culture and employee experience, internal communications and diversity & inclusion (D&I), as well as events and campaigns designed to celebrate and promote company heritage, values and beliefs.
Build a cross-functional European Employer Branding Community, providing strategic input and guidance on global EVP / employer brand strategy development to enable smooth regional deployment.
Driving innovation and standard methodology through considered and forward-thinking Employer Branding & cultural expertise (including D&I):
This includes finding opportunities for policy and process improvement, new innovation and regional consistency e.g. employee resource groups, Employer Brand guidelines, surveys (candidate, new hire, leavers, recruitment agencies) etc.
Defining and building our Employee Value Proposition (EVP), employer social media strategy and other cultural enhancement opportunities to drive engagement, attraction and retention.
Inspiring our people to be brand and culture advocates and to create and share their career stories and employer reviews.
Bringing employer branding and our culture to life externally and internally through different channels (including social media) using authentic storytelling throughout the employee lifecycle.
Working closely with subsidiary Talent Attraction/Recruitment teams to:
Create and implement multichannel recruitment marketing campaigns to generate awareness and support direct sourcing via the Shared Service Centre (SSCE) at a European level (with scope for localisation), from campaign concept through to tactical delivery;
promote presence at key events, with the aim of attracting diverse talent.
Explore, recommend and encourage inclusive recruitment practices to strengthen workforce diversity
Developing a library / toolkit of ‘on brand’ content for local subsidiary use both internally and externally. Also ensuring consistency of the look, feel and tone of everything we do, in alignment with our corporate brand guidelines.
Identify awards (GPTW, Best Companies etc.) and PR opportunities focused on positioning as a great place to work.
Harnessing opportunities for support / resource / knowledge exchanges from other areas of the internal business, with expertise and interest in these areas.
Explore opportunities for enhancing the employee journey from the initial candidate experience through to life after.
Help ensure that the right strategies, data and programmes are in place to promote an inclusive workplace.
Enhancing communication:
Between HQ and Subsidiaries. This includes ensuring global priorities relating to D&I, Culture and Employer Branding filter through to subsidiaries and conversely subsidiary feedback reaches HQ through one regional voice.
Evolve a consistent approach to colleague communications within and across Europe
Building the business case and, subject to approval, leading deployment of a pan-European communications platform.
Create /review European HR communications as needed.
Creating and running clear project plans for areas of responsibility (complete with budget).
Using data analytics to advise strategic direction and ensure currency of approach.
Regularly benchmarking the competitive landscape to stay up to date with trends.

Introduction:

Sprout IT greatest asset is its talent! We have an exciting opportunity for an amazing 2nd Line Analyst who wants to make an impact working at a great company. Working as part of our ServiceDesk team, you will provide higher second level support to high calibre clients.

About You:

You have a flair for tech and like to provide robust service delivery to our clients, with a strong will to make a difference. Thrive in a dynamic environment, prioritising and multi-tasking effectively, as well as problem solving whilst providing excellent communication, customer handling and inter-personal skills. We are committed to providing outstanding customer service (internally & externally) and you will be, too!

Capable of spotting opportunities to refine and improve processes and service and can communicate effectively with clients and third parties both face to face and over the phone, in a friendly and highly confident manner demonstrating excellent internal and external customer communication skills. Able to demonstrate initiative and have excellent lateral-thinking and problem-solving skills. You are flexible and adaptable - excited by new ideas and/or technology and, keen to pick up and work with new initiatives. You demonstrate deep knowledge of the Sprout IT core values, vision and mission of building relationships through trust.

Role & Responsibilities
To provide second level support to clients.
You will support the 1st and 2nd line teams to resolve issues that come into the ServiceDesk.
Take pride in ensuring that incidents are resolved in a timely manner to meet defined service level targets.
Complete relevant and skilled investigations, before escalating to 3rd
ServiceDesk members more junior than you, will love to learn from you, your work ethic and professional IT skills.
Required Competencies:
You must have experience of
At least senior 1st line responsibilities ideally within an MSP environment
Microsoft Office 365 Exchange Online, OneDrive, SharePoint OnLine
Windows 8.1 and later
Windows Server 2012 R2 and later
Microsoft Exchange 2013 and later
Email security products, e.g. Mimecast / MessageLabs
Networking knowledge covering LAN/WAN technology fundamentals
Citrix XenDesktop 7.15 and later (administration, user support)
Experience in these technologies is not essential, but would be an advantage
Microsoft Server/Client OS and/or Office 365 Certifications advantageous but technical ability and aptitude for problem solving is of higher value
Active Directory including knowledge of DNS, DHCP, Group Policy
Remote Monitoring and Management
Who Are We?

We are forward thinking IT specialist based in Farringdon, in the heart of London, as well as Wellington, New Zealand. Our mission is to provide outstanding IT solutions, strategy and consultancy to our 100% legal client base. We are committed to the highest standard of integrity and our shared values of Mutual Growth, Relentless Ambition and Shared Responsibility guide our actions and what’s important to us as an organisation. They are also the underpinning of our company culture.

Benefits:

Sprout prides itself in providing everything you need to feel happy, healthy, developed and resourced. There are more than a few reasons to be part of our amazing team.

Remuneration
£28,000 - £32,000 per annum,
Pension scheme & contributions
Private Healthcare (Vitality)
Up to 20 Days Annual Leave, Plus 1 Day off for your Birthday
Holiday buy-back scheme
Season ticket loan
Role Specific Training and Development with study leave
Continuous Professional Development scheme with incentivised training and exam structure

Technical AV Support Specialist - Central London £30,000 - £45,000

Audio, Video, Video Conferencing, Control Systems, Web Casting, LCD/Plasma Displays,

An exciting opportunity has arisen to work for a company to provide onsite "White Glove" critical AV support to C suite Executives and Senior Leadership teams within a global organisation. I am looking to build a small focused team of 2 to complement each other and support the Head office AV Infrastructure

What will I be doing?

Day to day you will be engaging with CFO, CIO, CEO level execs and other Senior leadership Team members providing VIP support. You will be sole persons responsible for all senior management meetings, conferences, presentations, town hall meeting both remote and local

What type of person are you looking for?

We are looking for a well presented (verbal, visual, written) and polished individual who doesn't get flustered under pressure. You will be able to work with senior stakeholder explaining to them how you are helping them and allowing them to feel comfortable that they are in safe hands. Imagine they are about to deliver a high level presentation and there is a technical issue or their laptop stops working. You need to be able to pinpoint solve and resolve whilst also keeping them in the loop. If you don't know the answer leaving them confident you will still be able to go away and fix this issue and also liaise with 3rd parties if it is a higher level issue affecting multiple users.

What interpersonal and technical skills do I need?
Experience in AV/V problem solving
Experience in problem diagnosis around projectors, microphones, speakers and amplifiers
Experience In troubleshooting around LCD/Plasma Displays
Experience in setting up AV conferences senior management meetings
Presentable, well-mannered polite and helpful
Can do attitude always willing to help.
Please apply today for more information

Job Title: Construction, Plumbing and Learner Support Technician (x2)
Job Description:
Salary
£14.89 (basic) + £1.80 (holiday) = £16.69 (total rate)
Job category/type
Casual
Attachments
Blank
Job description
About the role:
We require a construction technician to work with our KS4, Entry 2 to level 2 and students with learning difficulties, in the construction and plumbing workshops at king’s cross centre.

You will be able to communicate effectively with people at all levels and work collaboratively as part of a team. You will have proven ability to manage competing priorities and demands and a willingness to learn new skills as required. You will have good levels of computer literacy including Microsoft Outlook and Microsoft Word.

About you:
You will be able to carry out various maintenance duties including workshop improvements and developments within carpentry, plumbing and decorating. You will have relevant knowledge of tools, materials and equipment relating to all workshop trades.

About us:
We are the largest college group in London. Our colleges include City and Islington College, Westminster Kingsway College, and The College of Haringey, Enfield and North East London. We are committed to success through equality and diversity.

About Westminster Kingsway College:
Westminster Kingsway College is a further education college in central London with centres in Camden and Westminster. It offers a huge array of academic and vocational courses for 16-18 year olds and adult learners, such as A-Levels, BTECs, Apprenticeships, Foundation Degrees, Access to Higher Education, employability training and short courses. It also offers bespoke training for employers and specialist programmes delivered in conjunction with the Peter Jones Enterprise Academy.

Westminster Kingsway is an award-winning provider of hospitality and culinary arts courses. For over a century it has been at the forefront of culinary arts education in the UK, providing UK restaurants with highly-skilled chefs, front-of-house staff and management. The college can count among its alumni Jamie Oliver, Ainsley Harriot and Selin Kiazim.

Job Title: IT Supporter / Client device experience specialist
Job Description:
South Pole is an energetic, global company offering comprehensive sustainability solutions and services. With offices spanning all six continents, we strive to create a sustainable society and economy that positively impacts our climate, ecosystems and developing communities. With our solutions we inspire and enable our customers to create value from sustainability-related activities.
Our Corporate Functions team is the “enablement engine” of South Pole. Behind the scenes, we provide the business with world-class solutions and best practices that sustain business growth and success. We cover key areas such as Finance, HR, Office Management, Legal, IT, Operations, etc. If you are a smart, ambitious and dynamic professional with a strong passion to make a real difference in the fight against climate change, the below position may be right for you!
Job summary:
With our global and cloud based South Pole IT infrastructure, we are connecting passionate professionals around the world. As an IT Supporter / Client device experience specialist, you will be part of the support team for our global IT client infrastructure. You will be part of the team who is responsible for bringing a good user experience to our employees, where you will to support them in their daily challenges.

Main tasks & responsibilities:
Provide First level IT support
Be the Helpdesk person in Europe
Order and manage notebooks, wifi networks, smartphones and video conference systems in Europe
Prepare laptops Computer for new starters with the help of MS Azure Domain and Autopilot
Manage Client devices in Europe
Create Manuals for Devices
Handle Hardware guarantee cases and replacements

You are collaborating with the IT helpdesk
Bring new solutions and ways into the South Pole IT Landscape

Completed education or training as a computer/client-device supporter

Database Administration Skills

What we offer:
At South Pole, we care about our employees as much as we care about the planet. South Pole is not just an employer, we are a Team. South Pole does not just offer people a job, we offer you a career. By joining our team, you will find strong purpose and deep meaning in everything you do. You will have the chance to make a real difference for our clients and for the planet, working alongside a passionate team of like-minded colleagues, while building your knowledge/skills and developing your career in a fun, dynamic, international and fast-growing organisation.
We’re a planet of 7.5 billion unique and different people. We all have a contribution to make and South Pole is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, national origin, marital status or disability. Our recruitment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.

Please switch to a desktop device before starting your application.
Portsmouth Hospitals University NHS Trust was rated good by the Care Quality Commission in its recent inspection report published in January 2020.
The Trust is committed to driving excellence in care for patients and communities, through its five-year strategy ‘Working Together’. In support of its strategy, in July 2020, the Trust became a university hospital, and will work to drive benefits for patients, colleagues and the local community by embedding research, education and training across the organisation.
The Trust’s main hub is the Queen Alexandra Hospital, which started life more than a century ago as a military hospital. Today it is one of the largest, modern hospitals on the south coast, with 1,200 beds housed in light, bright, infection resistant, en-suite wards. With a turnover of close to £600m, the Trust provides comprehensive secondary care and specialist services to a local population of 675,000 people across South East Hampshire. Some tertiary services are provided to a wider catchment in excess of two million people. The Trust employs over 7,300 staff and is the largest employer in Portsmouth.
We welcome and encourage applications from individuals from diverse backgrounds. We recognise the value that a diverse workforce has in initiating fresh ideas and the contribution to delivering excellence for our patients, their families and carers.
Transfer Team
We are seeking motivated and hardworking individuals to work as part of the Transfer Team for the Trust.
This role will include preparing and packing patients for transfer, communicating with other staff members and transferring patients from clinical area to other clinical areas in beds and wheelchairs.
This role requires a lot of patient interaction and physical exercise as you will be transferring patients in beds or chairs across the hospital throughout the shift. You should be a team player with excellent communication skills, as you will work closely with clinical and management teams across the organisation.

Closing date 20th November 2020


Help keep well informed about Portsmouth Hospitals University NHS Trust and follow us on our social media channels by using the links to the right and Twitter - @QAHospitalNews
Please note Portsmouth Hospitals University NHS Trust communicate all correspondence to applicants through the NHS Jobs website, therefore please ensure you check your NHS Jobs account regularly for interview details and other information. Also note that when using a "free" email account such as hotmail or yahoo, please ensure you check your "junk mail" on a regular basis as well as your inbox.

For some posts, we are receiving large volumes of applications, on these occasions we may close the post early, therefore you are strongly advised to submit your application as soon as possible.
Disclosure and Barring Service Check
This post is subject to the Rehabilitation of Offenders Act (Exceptions Order) 1975 and as such it will be necessary for a submission for Disclosure to be made to the Disclosure and Barring Service (formerly known as CRB) to check for any previous criminal convictions.


Tier 2 Certificate of Sponsorship
Applications from job seekers who require current Tier 2 sponsorship to work in the UK are welcome and will be considered alongside all other applications. However, non-EEA candidates may not be appointed to a post if a suitably qualified, experienced and skilled EU/EEA candidate is available to take up the post as the employing body is unlikely, in these circumstances, to satisfy the current Resident Labour Market Test which will be in place until the end of December 2020. UK Visas and Immigration requires employers to complete this test to show that no suitably qualified EEA or EU worker can fill the post. For further information please visit the UK Visas and Immigration website.
From 6 April 2017, Tier 2 skilled worker applicants, applying for entry clearance into the UK, have had to present a criminal record certificate from each country they have resided continuously or cumulatively for 12 months or more in the past 10 years. Adult dependants (over 18 years old) are also subject to this requirement.
Guidance can be found here Criminal Records Checks For Overseas Applicants
