Specialist Support Officer (Mental Health)
Location: Camden, London

Salary: �25,500 per annum

Hours: 37.5 per week

8am – 4pm / 10 – 6pm / 1pm – 9pm on a rota basis

3 weeks weekends on followed by 3 weekends off

Contract: Permanent

Travel: May be required on an ad hoc basis

�

Are you an experienced and ambitious Specialist Support Officer looking for a new challenge?

We have a unique and exciting opportunity to be part of our assessment and support service in Camden. This facility caters to vulnerable adults with on-going high needs mental health. It consists of 15 self contained flats that our service users live in a fixed period.

�
The Role:
The role of Specialist Support Officer is to take lead responsibility in the application of defined specialist interventions (e.g. Social Work, Psychology, Drugs & Alcohol). You will have responsibility to advise the teams on changes to best practice whilst keeping new legislation in consideration. This role will play a vital part of providing support to customers through a key-worker and or group work system. You will have the ability to carry out interview assessments, support planning and risk assessments for customers with high support needs.
Benefits:
Annual leave

Pensions – One Housing is a sector-leader in the contributions we make to our colleagues’ pensions.

Buying and selling annual leave - We know that getting the balance right between work and home life is a big part of supporting our colleagues’ wellbeing.

Paid time off to volunteer in our communities.

Season ticket loans

A healthcare cashback plan – allowing you to claim back cash for you and your family’s routine healthcare.

Colleague recognition scheme – we let you know when you’ve done a #greatjob

One Academy – our innovative, in-house learning and development offering, designed to support with your personal and professional development.

Study leave – up to five days off per year to study toward a relevant qualification.

Career break - after three years’ continuous service.
Skills & Experience
Previous experience within in a Mental Health setting (essential) Knowledge of specialist assessment tools, methods and case formulation.
Knowledge of evidence based specialist interventions appropriate for community settings.
Experience of undertaking customer assessments, support planning and key-working with a clear outcome focus Knowledge about recovery model, peer support and coproduction procedures.
Experience working in community settings therapeutically, including assessments, designing interventions and demonstrating outcomes.
It is desirable you hold a BSc. in the relevant fields and an obtained MSc.

About us:
One Support, part of One Housing, provide support to a wide range of people, including young people, people with mental health problems, ex-offenders, and people with substance misuse problems. We provide services to people living in our properties, and also in their own homes – not necessarily those owned by One Housing. Our services include Floating Support, Supported Housing, Mental Health services and Young People’s services.

�

If this sounds like the opportunity for you, please apply!

As an organisation with a strong social purpose, One Housing works in some of the most diverse communities in the UK and their workforce reflects that. We understand the strength we gain from having and supporting our diverse teams. The different skills and experiences that our colleagues from different backgrounds bring to us allow us to make better decisions, consider different views and be an altogether more interesting and cohesive place to work.

We welcome applications from everyone, regardless of their background.

Support users by providing technical product support to enhance their overall product and service experience; through strong product and application knowledge assist users with technical queries enabling them to successfully configure, manage and complete their project.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Respond to user inquires through various communication channels including phone, email, chat, etc. regarding how to use the product and tool features to accomplish their specific tasks or milestones.
May assist users in the setup and configuration of tools and features within Datasite's technology products.
Using product knowledge, this role will provide support to our users who are experiencing simple or more complex issues with our products; troubleshoot and directly answer user questions to resolve the issues they are experiencing, and route issues that the Product Support Specialist is unable to resolve to the appropriate person or team for timely user resolution.
Provide educational tutorials and support on the platform's capabilities and functionality to users; Build positive relationships while being proactive in anticipating client needs.
Develop knowledge of industry and clients' use cases, in order to more fully understand background of support questions.
Capture client product support requests through internal workflow tools to ensure excellent user experience and support business metrics and reporting.
Participates in mentoring and guidance of less experienced colleagues.
Minimum Requirements (Education, Experience, Skills)
Degree preferred;
Strong technical aptitude and learning ability.
Previous experience in a client service or operational support environment.
Superior communication skills, especially in explaining technical terms in a way that non-technical individuals can understand.
High degree of independent problem solving and troubleshooting skills.
Ability to work well in a team collaboration environment.
Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.
Fluency in German & English (written & spoken)
Additional Information (i.e. schedule, hours)
Shift is Monday to Friday from 8:00am - 4:00pm

Overview of job

We are looking for an Operations Specialist to join our energetic and growing Operations Team at MediaCom. The Operations team are fully responsible for digital display and print media campaign activation. Each member of our team can be thought of as a Project Manager liaising with many different internal teams and external media owners to ensure a campaign launches on time and delivers as per the client requirements.

Reporting of the role
This role reports to the Operations Manager
3 best things about the job:
Overseeing the booking to billing process of campaign activation
Learning about the whole digital landscape and how display fits into a client’s strategy
Working with a friendly and sociable team

Measures of success –
In three months, you would have:
Got to grips with the booking to billing process for digital display campaigns
Forged positive relationships with your client teams and Ops counterparts through proactive learning and attention to detail
In six months, you would have:
Independently booking digital display campaigns
Troubleshooting technical issues that may arise in campaign activation
In 12 months, you would have:
Actively coming up with idea and solutions to make improvements to the client’s account
Working on team projects to make agency workflow more efficient
Responsibilities of the role:
Owning operational business tasks including accurately booking media plans onto systems
Coordinating the execution of strategic client campaigns from booking to launch
Collaboration with Tech counterpart to ensure all plans are implemented efficiently and on time
Compiling daily/weekly/monthly reporting to client specification
Owning monthly financial reconciliation of Digital campaign activity
Proactively managing financial queries to resolution
Working collaboratively with Business Group counterparts to find solutions
Support Ops Team workload balancing and junior team members’ learning
Building positive working relationships with internal and external stakeholders
What you will need:
Experience within an Ad Ops / Campaign Manager / Project Management function
Demonstrable track record of good performance/achievement
Strong interpersonal and relationship building skillset
Process-driven with solutions focused mind-set and a customer-centric attitude
Team player who motivates others and encourages close collaboration
Proven ability to manage workload in a highly pressured environment
Adept at prioritisation, organisation, multi-tasking, time management and project management
Strong accountability to meet deadlines
Good at problem solving – with the ability to resolve issues in a timely manner
Accuracy and a keen eye for detail
Competent in Excel and data analysis
Strong communication style, with the ability to utilise this to manage stakeholder expectation
Preferential skills/experience:
Knowledge of end-to-end trafficking process; including pixels, creative tags and specs
Aptitude to document operational best practice across the agency
Commercial awareness and understanding
Able to train others and encourage knowledge sharing across team
*Although we cannot make guarantees, we welcome conversations about flexible working for all roles at MediaCom London*

About MediaCom

Welcome innovators, initiative takers and instigators.
We are 8,500 of the world’s leading media communications specialists, in 125 offices, across 100 countries.
We have a global client roster that’s the envy of our peers. Adidas, Coca-Cola, Mars, P&G, PSA, Richemont, Shell and Sony to name but a few.
We help brands unlock growth through media. We do this using our Systems Thinking approach to data, technology and creativity and design communication strategies that build brands and generate sales. We’re part of WPP, the world's largest marketing communications services group, which gives us access to the richest data sets and most robust benchmarks in the business.
All this has helped us become the first network to hold the big six Media Network of the Year titles concurrently.
But the real secret to our success is simple (and not really a secret). It’s our People First, Better Results philosophy.
We know that when we invest in our people, we’ll deliver better results not only for them, but also for our clients.
We also know that talent comes in all shapes, sizes, genders and ethnicities. That’s why our agencies are open environments that celebrate difference.
Do you want to work with smart, creative, enthusiastic people? So do we.
Welcome to MediaCom

To find out more about MediaCom visit us here: www.mediacom.co.uk

Follow us on Twitter: www.twitter.com/MediaComUK

Follow us on Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/mediacomuk/?hl=en

Want to join a team with a mission to improve and save lives?


We continually look for motivated and skilled individuals who are interested in supporting our customers – healthcare professionals who use our products to help patients and their communities.

We currently have the following opportunity available - please contact us for more details!

Description –


Support Specialists are primarily responsible for supporting the Elekta product family, associated third-party products and the people who benefit from their use.

The key activities of the role are supporting customers, business units and distributors with their product issues. Product support requests will be submitted to the support team via phone, email or customer portal. It is vital that all product issues are reviewed in a professional and timely manner with the clinical impact of the issue being identified as quickly as possible to determine the case priority.

The individual is expected to be first and foremost a good communicator with excellent interpersonal skills and dedication to our customers.

Level 1 support specialists are expected to have the appropriate passion and drive to develop their knowledge to enable them to progress to the next level of support specialist.

Responsibilities -
Primary resource for answering phone calls from customers, business units and distributors seeking product support
Troubleshoot product issues in a live clinical environment
Prioritize activities to ensure clinical system down problems receive immediate attention
Document all support activities in line with Elekta policies and procedures
Resolve and/or escalate cases as required. (spend no more than 30 minutes on an issue before requesting assistance from level 2 or level 3 support specialists)
Attend internal and external training as required. Demonstrate knowledge and skills obtained from training.
Visit customer sites (accompanied by senior staff) to investigate and resolve product issues
Prioritize and managing cases in an efficient and professional manner
Communicate with customers to understand the problem, localize the origin, and troubleshoot efficiently to bring about swift resolution
Clearly explain to the customer what steps are necessary to diagnose and resolve the problem so that they are fully aware of the implications and timescales involved
Escalating and seeking advice and assistance as required in order to ensure all issues are managed to a satisfactory resolution in the fastest possible time
Ensuring that all interested parties are aware of ongoing or escalating issues, progress being made and any plans that have been put in place
Ensuring that the customer is fully aware of the implications of any work being undertaken before that work commences.
Documenting and having that work accepted by the customer before leaving site or closing the case.
Be flexible to travel at short notice
Relevant Knowledge, skills and competencies -
Knowledge of PC/Network Computing is preferred.
Experience in medical imaging, linear accelerators and/or clinical use of radiotherapy products is desirable
Identifying any necessary training requirements and escalating these to management as needed.
At least one European language in addition to English (mother tongue level) Preferably German or French
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Ability to effectively interact with customers and colleagues
Ability to work in a team environment
Flexible and accommodating approach
Ability and desire to promote Elekta’s professional image
Can demonstrate outstanding customer care skills
Experience in a support environment (desired)

Heard of us?

We’re an award-winning bank; backing people to fulfil life’s hopes and dreams.

Now is your chance…

The Agreement Services team deal with administration tasks and on-going agreement maintenance on Asset Finance deals following set up. To be able to respond quickly and thoroughly to our internal colleagues’ requests and complete daily tasks on time and accurately. Ensuring we live up to our overall team key deliverables and within agreed Service Level Agreements (SLA’s), governance, compliance and regulations.

We attract talent; by being fully immersed in our business, influencing and understanding our short, medium, and long-term aspirations. We develop our people; to ensure they fulfil their hopes and dreams, whilst continuing to meet the needs and expectations of our dynamic business.

We are a high performing, high profile team. We have worked hard to establish ourselves as trusted advisors; providing the correct balance of knowledge and challenge which supports managers and leaders make the right decisions at difficult times.

When the time is right, we would love to welcome you to our Reading office. In the meantime you will be based remotely. You’ll be made to feel part of your new team by your Line Manager, who is The Agreement Services Team Leader, and colleagues through regular contact and virtual interaction.

What would your day look like?
Issuing welcome letters and providing documents to new customers
Printing, scanning and photocopying
Sorting agreement packs for boxing, archiving and storage
Sending statements and copy documents
Franking outgoing post, sorting and allocating incoming post
Maintaining spread sheets
Ad-hoc system and agreement amendments
What do we expect of you?
Good team player skills are essential with a track record of working within a dynamic team
Ability to work under pressure in a fast-paced environment
Great attention to detail
Works efficiently and looks for continuous improvements

What can you expect of us?
A friendly and flexible culture, synonymous with our proposition to our customers.
A growing organisation that defines itself as being nimble, lean and strong.
A drive for continuous improvement, which you will be empowered to get behind from day one.
A communicative, accessible and approachable ExCo.
And of course, you will be compensated competitively, with a good range of core benefits and bonus potential.

Still Curious?

Aldermore Group was formed by bringing together two very successful businesses, Aldermore Bank and MotoNovo Finance, under the First Rand umbrella. Whilst our parent company operates internationally from their HQ in South Africa, we are a UK-based financial services specialist that supports our customers across a range of products and services, with hubs throughout the UK, including London, Reading, Manchester and Cardiff.

Underpinned by our strategic blueprint, “backing people to fulfil life’s hopes and dreams”, we thrive upon saying “yes” to our customers. We respect the ingenuity of entrepreneurs and their startups; we give first-timers a leg-up onto the property ladder; and we open up the lending market to many.

This is where you come in. We are on a journey. A journey defined by a destination; to deliver on our purpose over the course of the next 3 to 5 years.

Join us today and we will make the same promises to you as an employee, as we do to each of our customers. We value your differences; welcoming applications from all sections of society. We continue to build an inclusive, empathetic and creative environment; where your views and contributions will inspire new ways of thinking.

Aldermore is an equal opportunities employer.

We do not accept speculative agency CVs. Any CV received by Aldermore will be treated as a gift and not eligible for an agency fee. PSL agencies should only send CVs if authorised to do so by HR.

Where a DBS check or CIFAS check is identified as necessary, all application forms, job adverts and recruitment briefs will contain a statement that an application for a DBS certificate or a CIFAS check will be submitted in the event of the individual being offered the position.

Microsoft Teams is the most innovative cloud platform in computing today and Microsoft is hiring Teams Technical Specialist (TS).
Microsoft TSs main goal is to win the technical decision of customers to purchase and use our technology. You will work in a team, enabling the customers through digital transformation by leveraging the Modern Workplace of Microsoft 365 and Surface. TSs are expected to be able to both own and win the customers technical decisions, as well as find new opportunities through their contacts and work they are on for sales people to further pursue. As a TS, you work within a virtual team of technical, partner and consulting resources to help educate your customers at a technical level, demonstrate and prove our solutions, and win the technical decision allowing the team to achieve/exceed quarterly Microsoft 365 suite, Teams, Surface and OEM Meeting/Calling devices sales/usage targets in your accounts. Being part of this team will allow you to maintain and develop your deep technical expertise across Microsoft and non-Microsoft cloud-based infrastructure technologies.


Responsibilities
You will help customers make technical decisions to build tomorrow’s business and IT solutions based on Microsoft technology.
You will be the subject matter expert on your local sales team leading technical presentations, demonstrations, workshops, architecture design sessions, production ready pilots for Teams Meetings, Calling and Devices ensuring customer security and compliance requirements are met; assisting with developing the Microsoft 365 Core, Teams Platform & Firstline ecosystem
You will lead to clear technical, competitive and security blockers to accelerate Secure Teams Meeting, Calling, and Devices sales and customer usage.
You will own winning the technical decision at customers for sales opportunities and usage scenarios, through tailoring your message, bringing ideas to customers, engaging with them to show our technology differentiation, and guiding them in decision making.
You will work with partners and others at Microsoft, as well as use our core tools, to extend your reach and the reach of your team, focusing on satisfying important customer needs You will be a vital connection and orchestration point for a variety of technical resources, by:
Orchestrating complex solutions with internal and external partners for multiple Microsoft products and services.
Helping identify and diagnose technical, architectural, and competitive blockers and respective solutions for sales opportunities and usage decision blockers and helping ensure that these solutions are implemented.
Sharing practical knowledge with partners to drive the sale, deployment, and adoption of Microsoft 365 suite, Teams Voice and Devices solutions.
Shaping current and future products, marketing strategies, and customer centricity ideas through your feedback to sales, marketing, and engineering. You will stay sharp, share your knowledge, and learn practices from others.
We encourage all our employees to continuously maintain and enhance their technical, sales, professional skills, and competitive readiness.
Your knowledge will be enhanced and shared by participating in internal Microsoft technical communities and in the broader industry through events, blogs, whitepapers, training, and articles for your domain.
You will be recognized for sharing, learning, and driving individual work that all result in business impact for customers, partners and within Microsoft. Microsoft encourages thought leadership and leadership from every employee.
Qualifications
Voice & Network Architect. Deep experience with, and ability to explain key benefits, trade-offs, and architectures relating to network routing (TCP/IP networking, switches, routers, firewalls and protocols), telecommunication platforms (TDM PBX & IP-PBX, A/V MCU, VTCs, SBCs, gateways); voice applications & integration (Auto Attendants, Call Queues, IVRs, ACD, Voice Call Control, Audio/Video/Web Conferencing and Devices, CDR, E-911, Voice/Fax, Voicemail, Enterprise Interaction Management, Work Force Management, Sales Automation, Contact Centers and Programmable APIs) and networks (PSTN, Wireless, IP) required.
Technical depth. Technical experience with design, configuration and implementation of infrastructure in Microsoft Teams Meetings, Phone System, Direct Routing, Devices supporting Meeting Rooms Solutions (Microsoft Surface Hub & OEM Devices) and Calling, interoperability with 3rd party Meetings & Phone System solutions and management cloud as well as competitive product knowledge (Zoom, Cisco, Google) required.
Cloud Trust. Demonstrated knowledge of identity, authentication, security, privacy, and compliance (including the EU General Data Protection Regulation) and how they factor into cloud and hybrid solutions required.
Collaborative. Able to work cohesively with customers, members of the Microsoft (or similar) sales, services, and marketing organizations and Microsoft (or similar) partners required.
Excellent Communicator. Communication and collaboration, organizational, presentation, deep technical product demo, writing, and verbal communication skills required.
Performer. Highly driven passionate person who consistently exceeds goals and expectations required.
Growth Mindset. Experience and passion for learning (technical and professional skills); implementing practices from others; trying, failing and learning from the experience; sharing practices and knowledge for others’ benefit required.
Technical breadth. Customer experience and demonstrated knowledge of Microsoft 365 data lifecycle management solutions for Firstline, Core Collaboration & Communications content; Teams platform extensibility for low code/no code as well as custom API’s; competitive unified communications solutions and how they factor into cloud and hybrid solutions with infrastructures, architecture designs, migrations, and technology management preferred
Executive Presence. Validated experience engaging with senior level executives preferred
Consultative Technical Selling and Challenger mindset. Validated experience in consultative technical selling approach, including bringing innovative ideas to customers problems and being customer focused preferred
Community Builder. Understand capabilities of, strategically be able to work with, influence cohesively, build and grow, Microsoft (or similar) customers, members of the Microsoft (or similar) sales, services, and marketing organizations, internal and external communities and Microsoft (or similar) partners preferred
Consummate Professional
Experience. 5+ years of related experience in technical pre-sales and/or technical consulting roles preferred
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field preferred.
Certification in domain-specific technologies preferred: Telecommunications or Networking Industry Certification (ie CTNP, CVA) or Vendor Certification (ie CCNA, CCNP, etc)

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.

Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.

Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

Card Operations Specialist (UK)

About Railsbank

Railsbank is the world’s leading global open banking platform that gives customers “access to global financial services” with 5 lines of code.

The company was founded by serial finTech entrepreneurs who previously founded successful and award winning companies like Evolution and Currency Cloud.

Since starting in 2016 in London the company has expanded across Europe, launched in Singapore and is currently extending capabilities in SE Asia, USA and Australia.

We are now scaling the company and are looking for exceptional people who share the same core values, to join team Railsbank.

The Role

Building on the high growth and success that Railsbank has experienced, we have exciting plans for further expansion.

You will be a key member of the Treasury & Payments team in London, reporting into the Card Operations Manager.

Key Responsibilities
To be involved, as directed by the Card Operations Manager in all new card programme launches to ensure that there has been due consideration to meet;
o Bank policies

o Relevant national legislation

o Card Scheme rules
To produce month end Visa and MasterCard fee statements between Railsbank and the issuer
Monitor all scheme notifications, ensuring that BAU processes are updated accordingly
To ensure that Railsbank’s operational processes are running smoothly and work in a proactive manner to identify and eliminate issues that may arise
To ensure that the operations of Card Services are and remain compliant with all bank policies, applicable legislation and card scheme rules
To produce a regular reconciliation of the Banking products between the client, the issuer and other payment providers
Processing/checking of related activities in the end to end dispute cycle
Handling queries regarding cardholder’s transaction disputes
Monitoring outstanding dispute cases in Aging Reports/ GL listings/ Card Associations Platforms etc
Regular follow-up / escalation on the long-pending items for logical closure with respective team within the company
Resolve variances through contacting internal and external stakeholders including card associations
Provide accurate information and reports to card associations as required
Railsbank is growing very rapidly, but remains a small company in which the team is required to contribute to many aspects of their departments’ roles in the wider business. The rate of change is very fast, and the role may also require work being undertaken, sometimes at short notice.

What we look for in your professional skills

You’re likely to be educated to degree level or equivalent, with excellent communication skills (across all media) and possess the ability to ‘get things done’ in a flexible dynamic organisation without having to rely on line-authority over other team members.

Skills/experience required:
At least 3 years in Card Operations experience relating to Chargeback and Settlements.
Strong experience communicating with customers and card schemes
Confident, transparent, open communication style to enable coordination with peer and customers
Highly self-motivated with strong sense of maturity
Detail oriented as scheme processes & chargeback processing requires coordination and tracking
Role location and hours

Unless agreed otherwise the role will be a full time role and you will be based in our London office.

What we look for in our team members and our values

Being an integral part of the Railsbank team and sharing our values are important to us.

The environment at Railsbank is fast-paced, exciting, and dynamic. It suits people that love to collaborate and support one-another.

We are all driven by the same values and are looking to welcome new people to the team that share these values.

Our values:

Excellence, accountability, diversity, work/life balance, trust, fun, inclusive, friendship, noble cause, and respect.

Equal Opportunities Employer:

Railsbank is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion or belief, colour, sex or gender identity, sexual orientation, age, disability, national origin, marital status, or any other basis covered by appropriate law.

Due to the nature of our business, a prerequisite of this role is satisfactory to us background checks on you, to help us safeguard our customers, end users, and our team. By applying for this role, you are aware that this is a condition of an employment offer.

Lou Reed sang about a perfect day and that’s what we want you and the people we support to have if you join us. But do so you’ll need to be an extraordinary leader with the ability to inspire, mentor and develop both your team and the people we support in to achieving extraordinary outcomes each and every day!

Our Banbury service is a purpose built, supported living development incorporating 6 individual one bedroom units where we support young people with autism and complex learning disabilities.

Supporting the manager and deputy manager you'll lead a team of support workers to provide extraordinary, person centred support, which is safe and maximises choice, dignity and independence. Acting as a role model and mentor to the support workers you’ll facilitate the use of sound judgment and creative solutions to enable people to achieve goals and explore new opportunities. You'll supervisor daily outputs and assist the deputy manager in managing staff performance, development and appraisals.

Working in partnership with the people we support, their family, our specialist support teams and external agencies you’ll help to plan and implement professionally designed and person centred support plans that improve the quality of their everyday life and enables the achievement of individual goals, however small or large, each and every day.

We are looking for a Business Intelligence tech specialist who will support our business units building and maintaining BI solutions and reporting systems in order to provide insights gained from analysing company data.

The ideal candidate has a degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or another quantitative field, is adept at using large data sets to find opportunities for product and process optimisation and using models to test the effectiveness of different courses of action.

You will have strong experience using Tableau and other data tools and data mining/data analysis methods, building and implementing automatic reporting solutions, using/creating algorithms and creating/running simulations.

The right candidate will have a passion for
Discovering insights in large data sets, identify trends and working with stakeholders to improve business outcomes;
Designing, developing and maintaining data visualizations and dashboards using large datasets from different sources
Responsibilities
Work with stakeholders throughout the organisation to identify opportunities for leveraging company data to drive business solutions.
Analyse data from company databases and data warehousing to drive optimization and improvement of product development, marketing techniques and business strategies.
Assess the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources and data gathering techniques
Maintaining and developing our suite of insight and performance reports to give stakeholders visibility of how the business is performing
Support company A/B testing.
Required Skills
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related technical discipline with 2-3 years experience
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with an emphasis on process optimization
Experience using query computer languages (SQL, Python, or others) to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets
Strong knowledge of Tableau to deliver your insights in a clear and engaging manner
Business acumen and understanding of the role of business intelligence
Experience working with and creating data models and architectures
Excellent written and verbal communication skills for coordinating across teams.
Nice to have
Experience using web services: Redshift, S3, Spark, etc.


Benefits

Free Soldo Card

Flexible Home Working Policy

Comprehensive Private health insurance

Bike to work scheme

Birthday day off

25 days holiday excluding bank holiday

2 volunteer days

Employee Assistance Programme

Wellbeing Programmes to make the most of working from home

Some important stuff;To meet our regulatory obligations as a financial services company, we will need to process background checks for all new employees. This will include Criminal and Credit checks. If you have any concerns or questions, please talk to the recruitment team on application. Soldo recognises that no two people are alike and offer equal opportunities to all regardless of gender, age, disability, race or sexual orientation.

Office location: London, UK

Job Title: Electrical Safety & Technical Support Engineer - North East London
Job Description:
About the role:
We are currently seeking an Electrical Engineer to form part of the electrical services team in order to provide specialist technical support and electrical safety support; within a specified geographical region, predetermined by your location.
The base location for this role is flexible across the whole London area
To undertake technical assessments and audits of Thames Waters electrical personnel, provide detailed technical reports and presentations, purveying the gravity of the needs in a persuasive manner.
Be a technical lead in projects and investigations. Champion Thames Waters Electrical safety rules policies and procedures
Delivery of LV electrical safety improvement projects.

Act as an Authorised Person (LV) across a geographical area issuing Permits to Work completed in line with the Electrical Safety Rules
Technical oversight and direction to newly qualified or appointed technicians
Practical and theoretical assessment of technical staff against company electrical policy and procedures.
Appoint technicians in line with job role and technical competence (Competent Persons Electrical assessment)
Follow up with field-based assessments, Identify Skill gaps or fade through electrical safety audits (SHE6 P)
Provide mentoring and coaching to address skill gaps some of which will require classroom based and practical teaching.
Leading local electrical technical community forums
Provide low voltage electrical technical support to our operations managers. Support around 12 line-managers with approximately 40 electrically skilled technicians, with the recruitment and development of their electrical staff
To be successful you will have the following skills and experience:
We are looking for an experienced apprenticeship-served industrial maintenance electrician with the potential to act as a focal point for support across multiple teams. You will have a good knowledge and understanding of health and safety requirements including electrical safety rules, although we’ll encourage you to expand your broader knowledge and technical expertise through training and development opportunities.
An industrial biased electrician having had an indentured apprenticeship.
Experience with the development and mentoring of trainees. Involved with safety auditing process writing detailed persuasive reports.
City & Guilds 236 or current equivalent City & Guilds 2391, HND or HNC in Electrical engineering and ideally, although not essential an ECS card.
Time served electrical apprenticeship to NVQL3 or equivalent
Several years experience in Electrical Engineering / Maintenance field.
Good knowledge and understanding of relevant health and safety requirements, especially the Electricity at Work Regulations and their application to the business.
Ideally an awareness of Dangerous Substances and Explosive Atmosphere Regulations and electrical equipment for use in potentially flammable atmospheres
Good IT skills. Working knowledge of SAP beneficial
Good interpersonal skills are required, especially in managing relationships with technicians and operational management
What’s in it for you:
Fantastic opportunity for the right candidate to join an enthusiastic team guiding the electro technical standards and oversite of an industry leading water utility company.
The successful candidate will benefit from excellent training and mentoring, with personal development opportunities which can lead to exciting career progression.
Our competitive salary package includes an excellent contributory pension, 26 days holiday per year increasing to 30 with length of service and a wider benefits scheme. This includes an annual pay review, season ticket loans, voucher scheme giving you money off in major retail outlets, loyalty awards for continuous service plus much more, including our refer-a-friend bonus, where you can receive up to £1,000 for helping someone get a permanent position within the company.
We’re also proud to be here for our local community, offering all our teams two days paid volunteer leave a year, as well as proudly supporting a lot of local events and charities.
Click here to view our full list of Rewards and Benefits
About us:
Thames Water is the UK’s largest water and wastewater company. We make a daily difference to millions of customers by supplying 2.7 billion litres of world-class water to around 10 million homes.
As our world changes, the need to take care of our most precious resource is greater than ever, both locally and globally. That’s why, at Thames Water, every one of our actions, big and small, matters every day. Water is essential to daily life, and that means our business is always open. We’re passionate about providing world-class tap water, now and for the future.
We’re also turning waste into power, self-generating 20% of the energy we use and, in turn, doing our bit for the planet. We’re reducing plastic waste by celebrating our tap water and rolling out an ambitious water fountain project. We’re using our voice to lobby for change and partnering with WaterAid to provide clean water to the world’s poorest communities.
Together, we’re building a better future for our customers, our region and our planet.
Thames Water is a unique, rewarding and diverse place to work. If you join our team, you’ll enjoy fast-tracked career opportunities, flexible working arrangements and unparalleled benefits. We’re also proud to be an equal opportunity employer, Stonewall Diversity Champion and Disability Confident Leader, welcoming individuals from all walks of life and leading the way with an award-winning mental health and wellbeing strategy.

The Company:
Morningstar is a leading provider of independent investment research in North America, Europe, Australia, and Asia. The company offers an extensive line of products and services for individual investors, financial advisors, asset managers, retirement plan providers and sponsors, and institutional investors in the private capital markets. Morningstar provides data and research insights on a wide range of investment offerings, including managed investment products, publicly listed companies, private capital markets, debt securities and real-time global market data. Morningstar also offers investment management services through its investment advisory subsidiaries. The company has operations in 27 countries.

The Group:
Morningstar’s innovative products and services transform our high-quality data, independent research, and technological expertise into well-designed tools that delight our clients. The Customer Success group is the ambassador of our talents and investments aiming to provide our customer's with unique experiences while helping them reach their business success goals. The sales, service, product management and development teams collaborate with this group to provide clients with relevant products and bundled solutions.

Responsibilities:
• Proactively build effective client relationships, including the ability to anticipate and listen to our clients’ needs and be responsive. Achieve this by working closely with clients, our sales & product teams to deepen our client relationships, act as the key product expert and come to a better understanding of how they use and manage our products & data; and identify opportunities this may present for Morningstar.
• Proactively contribute to the renewal process and drive a strong renewal rate by continuously managing client satisfaction levels;
• Coordinating with technology and product management teams to refine existing client solutions; and working closely with sales teams to identify & evaluate potential upsell opportunities.
• Maintain and build strong client relationships by creating feedback loops that identify key areas for improvement in our service offerings, monitor risk, drive value-add activities, highlight new business opportunities and areas to improve customer satisfaction.
• Serving as a subject matter expert to Morningstar clients with a particular workflow.
• Maintaining a thorough understanding of our data, research and technology solutions and conducting regular business reviews with clients to provide updates on value-add activities from Morningstar and to ensure alignment between client success priorities and Morningstar success Plan.
• Ensuring key internal stakeholders (Strategic CSM, sales, support, data, product and technology managers) are aware of sensitive client information that impacts the overall relationship and to enhance existing client solutions.
• Working with our global data and product teams to efficiently deliver new data sets and product capabilities to clients.
• Acting as a product consultant, answering a variety of product-related questions, or collaborating with other internal resources as necessary to resolve questions and communicate to the client.
• Implementing an effective onboarding client experience to increase product & services adoption.
• Training home office representatives/solution-administrators/CSMs or Client Education teams to ensure end-users are supported in a coordinated manner.
• Work proactively to identify upsell and cross-sell opportunities through regular client interactions and relationship building activities.
• Acting as the point of escalation for the account (globally where applicable) and coordinating both internally as well as with the client to resolve escalated issues.
• Ensuring the voice of the customer and client satisfaction expectations are appropriately represented in product roadmap decisions and that the highest quality of service is offered to our clients.
• Enhancing our global service delivery model.

Requirements:
• Two to five years of client service, training or sales experience.
• A deep client service focus with strong technical, presentation, communication and consultative skills both written and oral.
• Excel in a fast-paced environment while still producing very high-quality, detail-oriented work.
• Proactive, strategic, and analytical thinker with a collaborative approach to problem-solving and project management.
• Ease in dealing with ambiguity; ability to create focus, coordination and keeping internal & external stakeholders on track.
• Ability to develop strong internal and external partnerships and relationships; take a collaborative approach; and work effectively across different business and functional areas.
• An intense desire to achieve client satisfaction and retention goals.
• Sound technical understanding of systems, data collection and delivery.
• Proven organizational and multi-tasking skills, as well as a thorough understanding of investment data, financial analysis and competitive landscape as well as market trends impacting our clients.
• Bachelor’s degree is required; an advanced degree is desirable.

Why we like working here:
• You will work in a Global team, together with both peers, product managers and other Morningstar employees all over the world.
• You will get to know the financial industry, our clients and their needs in a unique way.
• You will work and deep-dive in all parts of Morningstar data.
• You will dig deep into Morningstar’s analysis and research.
• You will have the chance to develop your technical skills and understanding.
• We have an inclusive, entrepreneurial culture where difference is embraced
• We love our teams, we work with amazing people.
• Casual dress code is the norm, no formal suits for us unless we have client meetings.
• We are in Shoreditch.

Please submit a resume and cover letter with your application.
Morningstar is an equal opportunity provider.

We have a unique job vacancy for a Full Time, Permanent, Behavioural Support Specialist to cover our clients Learning Disabilities services throughout South East London, Surrey & Kent. We welcome applications from people with a Psychology background.

Apply

Job Title: Super-user / Success Specialist Salesforce CRM (EMEA ANZ)
Job Description:
Title
Super-user / Success Specialist Salesforce CRM (EMEA ANZ)

21-Oct-2020

Business
EMEA - GTS - EANZ Commercial

State/Country/Province
United Kingdom

No. of Positions
2

Job Description
Super-user / Success Specialist Salesforce CRM (EMEA ANZ)

Position Summary
*Role is 100% virtual/remote, you will have the option to use our offices if required*

A new position, integral to the overall Stanley Black & Decker (SBD) digital transformation strategy as we look to leverage technology in order to improve sales conversion and effectiveness and evolve and optimize the business planning process and maximize automation opportunities across the EMEA ANZ region.
The role will work closely with the CRM Manager and SBD Transformation teams in supporting both the roll-out and ongoing usage, development and maintenance of the Salesforce Lightning platform across the region. The role will combine both Salesforce.com platform development and maintenance alongside training and deployment across the EMEA ANZ region whilst building and managing relationships across markets.
Internal job position title: Salesforce Administrator (EMEA ANZ)

Responsibilities
Be a key advocate and ‘super-user’ for the Salesforce.com platform across the EMEA ANZ region within Stanley Black & Decker (SBD)
Understand key SBD business requirements (including organizational culture and structure) and how to effectively translate to the possibilities within the Salesforce.com platform
Unlock A.I. and automation potential across the Salsforce.com platform to support more efficient SBD business planning and strategy
Lead efforts to develop, train and expand use of the CRM platforms to optimize productivity and effectiveness resulting in enhanced user knowledge and competency with Salesforce.com
Be a key resource for user support across all EMEA ANZ markets including:
Report and dashboard creation across all user groups
Case / incident resolution (in conjunction with IT)
System enhancement identification
Overall support (including technical) for the Salesforce.com platform
Provide daily administration of the Salesforce.com database including (but not limited to) managing multiple user set-up, profiles and roles, customization of objects, fields, record types, page layouts and validations and workflows
Create and maintain documentation on processes, policies, application configuration and help / training related materials for users as database applications and functionality are developed
Support data management activities to ensure a high level of data quality and integrity is continuously maintained
Assist in development of governance and principles and help ensure adherence
Play a critical role during upgrades and releases to the system including testing, driving change management and executing deployments
Deliver effective training (including creation of relevant materials and media) to different user groups to support ongoing market launches (eg. Salesforce Lightning upgrade) and general functionality / platform development
Understand and define generic and individual user / market business requirements and effectively document and communicate to the IT team
Monitor the administration and resolution of issues by the IT team to ensure in line with defined limits
Build strong relationships with the managers of (and other key stakeholders within) the user group across markets to ensure proper and consistent use of the Salesforce.com platform in line with EMEA ANZ regional strategy
Share and re-enforce best practice across markets
Be ‘the voice’ of the user community and report back to management on commonly requested changes to the Salesforce.com application
Track and report back on platform usage and adoption to senior management
Monitor alignment and synergies across Salesforce.com platforms (Sales Cloud / Marketing Cloud / Commerce Cloud) through communication and collaboration with other relevant management teams and stakeholder groups
Assist with integration and usage of related CRM / Sales Enablement tools eg. Showpad and Altify
Qualifications
Minimum 3 years Salesforce.com / CRM system administration experience
Possession of extensive Salesforce.com platform knowledge and tactical skill, understanding how changes can positively impact the user community
Salesforce Administrator certification is preferred (SDM201)
Ability to build custom apps and objects, formula fields, workflows, customer views, dashboards and reports and other content
Ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders
Commercially orientated with an understanding of standard business processes, ideally, with experience of working with sales teams using Salesforce.com and selling into a retail environment
Strong communication and inter-personal skills in dealing with a range of internal customers including senior management stakeholders (in order to ‘sell to’ and ‘service’ the user group)
Ability to operate with confidence at different levels of management
Proven track record as a ‘Change Agent’ with direct experience of driving positive integration and adoption of Salesforce.com across multiple territories
Highly analytical and with a strong attention to detail
Have expertise in building reports and dashboards that deliver meaningful insights
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and experience in using other reporting software and tools eg. Tableau, SAP, BI, etc.
Proactive attitude and approach with an ability to identify ongoing process refinements aligned to business needs
Experience of building business cases to support systems development
Exceptional English communication and presentation skills (written, verbal)
Additional European language fluency a benefit
Excellent training skills (delivery and content creation)
Experience of working in a matrixed, global organization beneficial

The Role
This is an exciting opportunity for you to be part of a team that has global reach across all Trading & Supply functions. You’ll serve as the Product and Workflow Specialist for Trading & Supply Compliance – requiring specialized skillset and dealing with complex statistics.

Where you fit in

The CDD Operational Support is a member of the CDD Operational Management team in Trading and Supply (T&S) Financial Crime (FC) Team which has responsibility for supporting the CDD Operational Manager with the management of the workflow, processes and tools used for new counterparty CDD, existing counterparty re-reviews and overnight screening. The team is also responsible for managing the KYC onboarding system (GoldTier) for T&S counterparties.

What’s the role

As a CDD Operational Support, you will be expected to define and design the Key Performance Indicators for Operational Management across Financial Crime. You will work alongside the CDD Operational Manager to ensure the maintenance and development of the workflow and CRM systems to support counterparty CDD, re-reviews and overnight screening.
You will assist in managing the global CDD quota and prioritisation queue and workflow between the Counterparty On-boarding Focal Points (COFs) and CDD team on an ongoing basis. Aside from that, you’ll act as a central point of contact for all CDD status queries from the T&S businesses (including Crude, Products, Energy, Shipping, Operations and Supply) and the Counterparty Onboarding Focal Points (COFs), escalating issues to the Financial Crime advisors as required.
Support the CDD Data Management Specialist and other roles with data quality improvement projects and supporting Counterparty Lifecycle Management Projects.
Support the CDD Operational Manager in co-ordinating with Shell IT and external vendors to develop the product roadmap for technology changes within CDD and the wider Financial Crime Team.
Work with Shell IT to ensure technology operating effectively and manage service outages, where identified.
Monitor and escalate issues impacting the T&S CDD and re-reviews processes to the CDD Operational Manager to ensure that they remain operational, and in compliance with the T&S Financial Crime Policy and KYC Standards.
Support the CDD Operational Manager and Financial Crime Managers in driving continuous improvement within the CDD teams, including embedding new ways of working, process re-engineering and improved cross-team communication.
Be an active, effective and collaborative member of the Financial Crime Team.
What we need from you
We’re keen to speak from individuals with significant experience of Know Your Customer end to end processes and ongoing Regulatory Requirements in a Financial Institution. Working knowledge of Know Your Customer Data Repositories is highly valuable, ideally GoldTier and/or Arachnys.
Understanding of the customer lifecycle with a Trading company.
Understanding of workflow and process management.
Understanding of Product Development Roadmaps, Business Requirements and Agile Ways of Working.
Experience working alongside and managing internal IT projects.
Understanding of Financial Crime Risks and Issues, including knowledge of CDD and Sanctions regulatory requirements is desirable.
Someone with good written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to engage with a wide range of stakeholders. Credible and persuasive, ensuring communications are backed up with robust data analysis.
COMPANY DESCRIPTION
Shell started operations in the United Kingdom more than 110 years ago. Since then we have grown into a leading innovative oil and gas company that rewards its employees by investing heavily in their careers and learning. Our people are our greatest asset, and our commitment to your career will see you thrive in a work environment that offers an industry-leading development programme. When your ideas travel, Shellwillbenefitand innovation will thrive. Shell has a key role to play in helping meet the UK’s growing energy demand, whilst using innovative technologies to develop cleaner energy. We are the largest FTSE 100 company in the UK by marketcapitalisation, andmake a significant contribution to the UK economy. As well as processing 35% of the gas coming into the UK, we serve more than four million customers at our filling stations each week. Shell employs some 6,400 skilled staff as well as many contractors.
An innovative place to work
There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell. Everyone here is helping solve one of the biggest challenges facing the world today: bringing the benefits of energy to everyone on the planet, whilst managing the risks of climate change.
Join us and you’ll add your talent and imagination to a business with the power to shape the future – whether by investing in renewables, exploring new ways to store energy or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently.
An inclusive place to work
To power progress together, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we’re nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills and reach your potential…
We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply and we’ll take it from there.
We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.
We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.
We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.
A rewarding place to work
Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.
We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.

Disclaimer
Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Before applying, you are advised to read our data protection policy. This policy describes the processing that may be associated with your personal data and informs you that your personal data may be transferred to Royal Dutch/Shell Group companies around the world. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. Shell is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Job Title: Special Needs Specialist Support Based in Hackney
Job Description:
Special Needs Specialist Support Based in Hackney
Rate: £60-£75 per day
Borough: Hackney
Protocol Education are looking for a Learning Support Assistant who specializes working with SEND students throughout all key stages.
Working with special needs is so rewarding with new exciting challenges that you can face every day. The school is based in Hackney East London and caters to students who have Moderate Learning Difficulties (MLD), Severe Learning Difficulties (SLD), Profound Multiple Learning Difficulties (PMLD) & Autistic Spectrum Condition (ASC).
The school appreciate career ambitious people as they have specific career ladder routes you can climb. The Ideal candidates would need to be:
oTeam player
oSafeguarding aware
oHappy to do personal care
oModerate SEN knowledge
oHappy take instruction
oBe resilient
oHappy to learn new skills
oHappy to help with personal care needs including feeding & changing

To be part of a school that takes pride in the benefit of working together to help students' development. As mentioned, this role is all key stages, including key stage 5 students. The school measures and assesses the impact of the careers program on students by tracking their destinations and considering, on an individual basis, whether this represents a new challenge for them, and continues their journey towards Fulfilment, Belonging and Independence.
Protocol Education are fully in compliance with Agency Worker Regulations, ensuring you receive equal treatment for pay and conditions after a 12 week qualifying period. Please ask for further details Successful applicants will be subject to satisfactory references, as well as possessing an up to date DBS or be willing to apply for one through Protocol Education.
If this role is of interest to you, or if you are considering another challenge in a SEND school, please contact Michael @ Protocol Education on 0203 219 7745 or michael.oduniyi@protocol-education.com .

Job Title: Behaviour Support Specialist needed in Jan 2020!
Job Description:
Do you have a qualification and the passion to work in a Primary School? Are you looking for a new role or maybe some day to day supply work? Protocol Education are working with primary schools across the borough to find dynamic and passionate Primary School SUPPPORT FOR PRIMARY SCHOOLS. We have a fantastic team in place who are in regular contact with our schools, assisting with their staffing for the new winter term. This is a brilliant opportunity to join a new school at the start of their new term or on a day to day basis.

As a successful Teacher Assistant with Protocol Education you will need to:

• Be passionate about teaching and education
• Have a creative approach to teaching
• Be flexible and adaptable
• Have good behaviour managements skills
• Excellent communication and lesson delivery skills
• A good work ethic.

Role Purpose

The Azure Cloud Security Engineer is a change agent and ambassador for cyber security. Their primary focus will be to drive the delivery of cyber security controls for the Azure cloud platform and services identifying and assessing security threats and risks, defining and enabling secure configuration, and leading security automation.

Key Accountabilities
Enable and enhance security configuration and DevOps practices through close collaboration with Azure DevOps and by providing secure design patterns, and a hands on security engineering capability. Supports the definition and implementation of security requirements.
Deliver security automation in the CI/CD pipeline via leadership, process automation and tooling.
Implement continuous security control testing, and improvements to monitoring of Azure security events and alerts through optimisation and automation.
Increase visibility of security threats and configuration weaknesses by optimising the configuration of cloud native security tools, e.g. Azure Security Center, SQL Server Advanced Data Security, and Azure Sentinel.
Reduce security vulnerabilities and configuration weaknesses through standards and increased awareness.
Use security risk metrics to enable DevOps and security to report on threats and the cyber security controls.
Additional responsibilities
Security Operations and Assurance requirements are enabled through Azure event alerting, and controls testing
ESSENTIAL
Deep understanding of Azure data protection and security architecture, and features including Security Center and Secure Score, Ddos attack mitigation, Azure Front Door / Web Application Firewall, Azure Key Vault, Network Security Groups, Azure AD Identity Protection and Privileged Identity Management
Good understanding of Azure Iaas, serverless architecture and Azure Cloud Platform services, Application Service Environments, Service Fabric, Azure functions, Azure API Management
Hands on Azure security configuration and scripting skills.
Experience with build and deploy technologies such as TeamCity, Octopus, Bamboo
Demonstrable experience and execution of security automation, and configuration of Azure cloud native tools to maximise their effectiveness
Ability to apply security principles and good practice to manage risk, e.g. authentication, role-based access, encryption
Collaborates to develop close working relationships with DevOps teams to build/deploy secure solutions and automate security in the CI/CD pipeline
Able to communicate complex technical topics in straightforward terms
Microsoft Azure certifications, e.g. Azure Security Engineer, Azure DevOps Engineer, Azure Solutions Architect.
DESIRABLE
Understanding of FCA and PCI data security control requirements
Developer background can code and understands development methodologies and frameworks
Hands on experience of technical security vulnerability assessments and penetration testing using Burp Suite, Kali Linux or similar
AWS cloud platform skills and knowledge, e.g. AWS Config configuration.
Personal Attributes
Builds partnerships through collaboration and being part of the solution
Able to influence peers focuses on risk and the why, and communicates complex technical topics in straightforward terms
Challenges conventional thinking and demonstrates a continuous improvement mindset

About You:

A post-secondary degree or diploma in Information Technology Management with experience supporting desktop computing needs within a networked environment, or equivalent combination of education, training and experience.

About Us::
Global Relay is the leading provider of cloud-based archiving, information governance, surveillance, and eDiscovery solutions to the global finance sector. We help financial services firms preserve and supervise their communications data for regulatory compliance, risk mitigation, and litigation readiness. We deliver our services to over 20,000 customers in 90 countries, including 22 of the top 25 global banks. Our market-leading archiving service supports email, instant messaging, text, market data chat, social media, enterprise social networking, voice, trade data, websites, and more. Recently, we also launched a compliant messaging platform specifically for the finance industry.

We’ve won major awards for our growth, management, and culture – including the Deloitte Fast 50 Leadership Award, Canada’s 10 Most Admired Corporate Cultures, and the Deloitte-sponsored Canada’s Best Managed Companies awards. Our Global Operations & Development Center is located in Vancouver, BC, Canada. In addition, we have offices in seven other cities across the world, including major financial centers like New York, Chicago, and London.

We’ve recently expanded our London operations to better serve our UK and EU customers. Our brand-new, four-story EMEA headquarters on Cannon Street (near St. Paul’s Cathedral) features state-of-the-art amenities, a spectacular view of the city, and a conference centre for customer events.

We provide fantastic opportunities to individuals passionate about business and technology. These opportunities include working alongside members of our leadership team. Receiving mentorship from seasoned technology and business professionals. And doing business with the world’s largest, most influential banks and enterprise organizations.

To learn more about our business, culture, and community involvement, visit www.globalrelay.com.

Mediaocean’s mission is to enable advertising agencies to leverage the power of technology in a rapidly changing digital landscape. Mediaocean is making this a reality through the creation of global, open and neutral operating systems that will benefit and transform the entire industry.

Job Description

What You Will Do:


Mediaocean seeks a Desktop Support Engineer that will be responsible for Desktop/Helpdesk administration and maintenance of all Internal IT Systems to join our team in Chicago! These systems include, but are not limited to, telecommunication systems (Ring Central) email systems (Office 365), Microsoft Active Directory, antivirus servers, web filtering servers, etc.

This person will work alongside other team members, and will help identify areas of the overall IT Infrastructure that can be revised, improved, enhanced, and possibly upgraded. This is an exciting opportunity for the right candidate who can mentor and work well with others!

Responsibilities will include:

· Serving London and Paris office, so must be bi-lingual in English and French.

· Primary desktop support for all end-users issues. Be known as the IT go-to-guy.

· Provide support for Jira/Confluence and other Atlassian products.

· Perform advanced diagnostics, analysis, repairs, or replacement hardware for PC's, laptops, and printers.

· Administration and support of Windows servers and virtual infrastructure

· Administration and support of multiple large scale Active Directory domains, Group Policies, User and Group management, auditing and security

· Administration and support of local and remote VMware vSphere environments, running Windows and Linux VMs

· Administration and support of Web Filtering solution using Websense (aka Forcepoint)

· Administration and support of McAfee ePO Antivirus Console to manage 1000+ endpoints

· Administration and support of Windows File Servers, with a focus on folder security and auditing. Windows Print Servers as well as DFS replication for File shares

· Provide 3rd level support and troubleshooting for issues related to MS Outlook Email / Calendars, MS Office, skype, Software support, etc.

· Diagnose hardware and software failures, communicates the remediation plans to users, and provide status updates.

· Support desktop maintenance, including inventory and software distribution, and security maintenance, including virus updates and patch management using Dell Kace.

· Provide remote assistance to users using Remote Desktop software as well as LogMeIn.

Who You Are:


· Bachelor’s Degree in information technology, computer science, engineering or related field.

· 1-5 years’ experience.

· Experience working with VMware vSphere servers and virtual machines / virtual desktop infrastructure.

· Experience troubleshooting and administering multiple Active Directory domains.

· Experience and broad knowledge of routing protocols, switch protocols, TCP/IP, Ethernet, ACL’s, VLANs, DHCP, DNS, SNMP, SMTP, iSCSI, RFC’s, and other network protocols, etc.

· Experience implementing, configuring and troubleshooting Windows Servers and services, Active Directory, DFS shares, AD group policies, user and group management, File permissions and ACL management, etc.

· Experience troubleshooting desktop and laptop hardware running Windows and Mac OS. (Linux experience a plus but not required).

Preferred but not required:

· Experience creating Powershell, VBS or other related scripts.

· Experience supporting 3CX software based VOIP IP communications infrastructure.

Role title

Modern Workplace Specialist – Market Development – Strategy & Innovation

Location: Europe

The Role and Accountabilities

Reporting to the Market Consultancy Director; the Modern Workplace Specialist will contribute to Colt’s market position as a leading provider of connectivity solutions by transforming market knowledge, customer perspectives, and leading edge technical competencies into innovative ideas for market development. In collaboration with the market development team, the specialist will consult with Colt partners (existing and new), analysts and customers to identify new technical solutions and joint value propositions incorporating voice and modern workplace services. The Voice Specialist will enable incubation and co-creation to deliver compelling value propositions that demonstrate true business value, that lead to Proof Of Concepts and that result in future productized Colt product offerings.

Strategic Skills
10+ Years’+ experience including a broad commercial acumen and market awareness in the Global Telecommunications eco-system.
A candidate who is up-to-date with customer ICT strategy, technology and policy and who can articulate competently the Modern Workplace market and the context of Voice solutions within the wider ICT environment, both to internal stakeholders, partners and end customers.
An awareness of the Partner eco-system in order to support the identification of new partners that can provide joint value propositions and an understanding as to how these are best brought to market
An Enterprise Architect mindset, knowledge of methodologies such as TOGAF, to guide the consulting and solution approach.
Commercial solution design including pricing, value proposition definition and governance compliance.
Commercial and product expertise to support joint value creation focused on business outcomes.
Developing and presenting the compelling business case both internally and externally.
Subject Matter Expertise
An expert in Modern Workplace solutions – Including Microsoft Collaboration products, but knowledge of Google/Amazon is also desirable.
An expert in traditional voice (ISDN, PBXs) and the customer transformation journey to the Modern Workplace and unified communications.
An expert in SIP Trunking, Modern voice Architecture such as SBC vendors, design and features.
Display high levels of expertise in the following products; Voice (IN & Out bound), Voice Infrastructure Technologies (traditional & Cloud), Modern Workplace and Contact Centre.
An understanding of IP networking and the interaction and implications of WAN Design on the Modern Workplace solutions.
Knowledge of wholesale voice, number porting, a software defined approach including APIs and Voice regulations.
Tactical requirements
A collaborative and open approach to working with different members within the Market Development team and with wider stakeholders within the business
Maintain a high degree of and thorough knowledge of all Colt products, services capabilities.
Maintain a high degree of and thorough knowledge of the Modern Workplace Eco-system
Develop a strategy to evolve the application and joint partner opportunities of the Voice offerings within Colt
Monitor competitor and market activity/trends and provide feedback in to Colt’s strategy and innovation business teams.
Critically evaluate 3rd Party partners and all Colt concerned departments to ensure solutions are relevant and within Colts ability to deliver.
Support contract construction and predict / overcome client concerns.
Meet and work closely with the partners and analysts to understand business objectives, needs, requirements and compelling criteria and best market practice.
Support the CCO organization including sales engineering teams to guide the release of new technology and solutions to the sales force.
Identify and quantify the associated gaps and risks within the strategy in conjunction with the Partner managers, and other supporting entities whenever appropriate.
Adherence to Colt governance processes, tools and sales methodology.
What you will need to succeed
Experience in solution consultancy and product co-creation
Proven track record of leading and operating within multi-partner teams
A thought leader and subject matter expert - Global telecommunications & competitive landscape.
Exceptional negotiation and influencing ability of digital transformation, voice and data architectural design.
Accustomed to engaging and presenting to influence at all levels.
Strong ability to convert requirements in to written documentation, proposals and Statements of Work for approval.
Excellent understanding of ICT challenges, technologies and the competitive environment.
Experience in working with international teams on longer term projects
Commercial Acumen - good understanding of pricing strategies, financial analysis methods and negotiation strategies

In addition to offering competitive salaries and incentive plans, a range of benefits and local rewards packages are offered to staff. Colt recognises the importance of a work life balance.

Some benefit examples are:
